Reviews.Title: “Mahalo Napili Kai”
Reviews.Author: Egglady12
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful way to end our stay on Maui. I would come back here in a minute. Beautiful Beach and wonderful snorkeling and paddle boarding. Swam with the sea turtles. The staff was so nice and helpful and the restaurant was fantastic. Try the cinnamon roll @ breakfast... yummy! If you like a low key place with the old hawaiian feeling you will love the Napili Kai Beach Resort. Rooms are roomy and clean and there are no elevators, crowds at the restaurant, beach or pool areas. You are not charged for a beach chair or snorkel equipment ( except they don't have fins). Snorkel Bobs is walking distance away so that problem was easily solved. They also had a nice laundry facility so I came home with all clean clothes and was able to pack very light. Aloha & Mahalo Napili Kai

Reviews.Title: “The resort that doesn't feel like a resort”
Reviews.Author: thermos5
Reviews.Content: We were so thrilled to have found this place. It is truly a top notch resort without feeling ridiculous and flamboyant. We stayed in 2 different rooms over the week and they both were new, clean and comfortable feeling. The beach is super. The snorkeling is very nice. Whale watching from our lanai or the beach was outstanding. The sea house restaurant is practically on the beach, but is not intrusive, and has great food and drinks, which you can just charge to your room. Napili bay is a little more protected on the north side, napili kai side, so the water is practically always calm. Close to other great snorkeling spots and Honolua Bay. Napili Kai has more of a neighborhood feeling than some elitist resort feeling but nothing is compromised, everything is top notch. The rooms had a full size fridge, stove and cabinets which made it nice for eating in. I'd go back and I highly recommend this to everyone of all ages.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Party on a beautiful evening.”
Reviews.Author: April005
Reviews.Content: We had the misfortune of being at the Napili Kai in late January when a horrible noisy party was held in one of the rental facilities. And I mean thumping loud music which could be heard up the entire bay, spoiling our evening as well as, I am sure, many others. Not sure how one can prevent this from happening again but we would not stay here again without some kind of assurance that noise from the rental facility would be controlled. Paradise is not a disco.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Hawaii ambiance”
Reviews.Author: pmdwarrior
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at the end of February 2012 in a studio apt. in the Lani 2 building. No air conditioning is needed as the Trade Winds and a ceiling fan do the trick. The large studio was recently redone with granite countertops in the kitchen, new cabinets, updated bathroom, and new furniture in the bedroom and lanai. The toiletries are wonderful. I was amazed at the fine quality of the kitchen ware and cutlery as well as the appliances. Everyone was gracious, welcoming and exhibited warm Hawaiian hospitality. No extra fees for parking, WiFi, beach towels, snorkeling equipment or other sports equipment. They don't "nickel and dime you to death". This place is not for the go-go-go folks. Leave that to the high rises in Ka'anapali Beach area. Napili Kai's charm is in the relaxed pace and feel of the resort. No high rises, and right on Napili Bay. Just roll out of bed onto the beach. Lots of grassy areas and nice gardens around the buildings. I thoroughly enjoyed my relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Maui's best”
Reviews.Author: Notmomo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 8 remarkable days in January 2011. The room was fabulous, spacious, the lanai was outstanding for relaxing and pleasure. The views were spectacular. Service was transparent, but exactly how we like it! Location allowed for gorgeous walks, romantic interludes, ample snorkeling, swimming, sea kayaking...we even had a sea lion on the beach while we enjoyed our breakfast. My kids and I went here in January 2005...there has been much growth in the area, but it's done tastefully and without too much negative effect. We will return! Now off to Guatemala!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, local, low profile”
Reviews.Author: beautytravelerLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one week in January, our last week out of 3 on Maui. The locations is fabulous, right on the beach, the staff super friendly in a genuine way. The rooms have all you need - nothing spectacular or 7 star, but very clean, new decor and furniture, spacious. If the large resorts in Kanaapali are not your cup of tea you will love this! Also try Kapalua beach in the next bay along for snorkaling, and Meeriman's for sunset drinks or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for total R&R--away from the crush, but an easy 10-minute drive to Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: bagsarealwayspacked
Reviews.Content: Napili Kai is such a restful, peaceful property that stress just melts away. There are wonderful services available (free snorkel gear, beach chairs, beach towels) and a great beachside restaurant that serves breakfast, lunch, happy hour/pupuu platters, and dinner RIGHT ON THE BEACH. You really never have to leave the property. We did go to the next beach up (Kapalua Bay) because we felt snorkeling was better, but it is literally right across the parking lot of Napili Kai. There was plenty of whale watching just sitting on the beach along with dolphins racing through the water so much so they looked like they were flying! And there were so many beautiful, colorful schools of fish along a couple of green sea turtles and stunning coral reefs when snorkeling. We plan to this our annual winter getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Old-school Maui. No crowds, no water parks, no fights over chairs”
Reviews.Author: misssnootysnoots
Reviews.Content: It's the perfect blend of condo and hotel. There's a kitchen, so you're not forced to eat out for every meal. Barbecues for seared ahi if you want. The best beach on Maui is right here. Free snorkels. Snack bar. Pupu parties. Right across the street from the Kapalua Tennis center. Beautiful Kapalua hikes begin at the next beach over, about 30 seconds away from the NK parking lot. There's an ancient Hawaiian salt-making site at the water's edge on the property. I can't say enough about the relaxed, quiet atmosphere here.

Reviews.Title: “Maui"s Best at Napili Kai Beach Resort”
Reviews.Author: Alston L
Reviews.Content: Maui is a busy island but I discovered Heaven at Napili Kai. It is what Hawaii used to be before the big multistory hotels were built: ceiling fans, doors that open to the beach and no noisy and unnecessary air conditioners! The two story buildings surround a gorgeous bay and beautiful beach. The rooms are comfortable, updated , including a kitchenette, with privacy from the next door neighbors. Our room was maybe 25 yds, from the water. The spacious and open grounds have two pools, lovely, well manicured gardens, a terrific and reasonable restaurant and super bar for after beach cocktails.. AND manicures and massages are available in a quiet corner of the grounds.The staff is beyond amazing and helpful in the old Hawaiian style of O Hana. We played golf every other day for two weeks at fabulous golf courses that are a short distance from the resort. Wish I played better golf! Most of the guests have returned for many years and so are friendly but not intrusive. There are morning programs and demonstrations about life in Hawaii. It is perfect for families and couples. Amazingly, all the children were well behaved and sociable.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, relaxing and authentic”
Reviews.Author: mallya
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on a beach front one bedroom during Thanksgiving 2011 and enjoyed the place from the second we walked in. It's tranquility, authentic hawaiian beautity, close calm beach, snorkeling and beach restuarant is so satisfying that we never left. I have stayed in many different resorts in my life time but Napili Kai is by far my favorit! The only suggestion for improvement I have is to improve the quality of the food served during holiday dinners. The Turkey dinner was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Back Again . . . 2011”
Reviews.Author: kaddyshak
Reviews.Content: This resort only changes for the better every year . . . we stayed in the newly remodeled PUNA II building and it is spectacular . . . I cannot imagine anything else that could have been done to make these units any more comfortable & "up ot date". The PUNA POINT building is closed right now for upgrade to all units and rumor has it that the owners of it & PUNA II are somewhat competitive as far as to which will have the better upgrade . . . if that is true then PUNA POINT should be nothing less than fabulous. The activities, both free & charge, are designed to keep you active . . . the Monday "Putting Party" on their 18 hole putting course is a really fun way to get to know other guests, not to mention the port-a-bar with 50 cent drinks. The complimentary Thursday Mai Tai is another guest function that lets you mingle. Anyway . . . our 29th adventure to Maui was great as usual and we hope to return next year although at our age air travel is getting to be a struggle . . . we can only hope.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing and a fabulous beach”
Reviews.Author: lovestocycle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in Dec 2011 and had a great stay. The resort is very, very luxurious, with a great beach, great clean pools, a generous beach hut for towels, snorkel gear etc (although staff at the beach hut weren't as available as I'd of liked at times). Each day there were various activities and shows to see + I enjoyed the 'morning coffee' served in the lobby each day. The onsite restaurant, Sea House, features great food but sadly rather obnoxious staff (compared to the very friendly and helpful staff throughout the rest of the resort). Well worth the 0.5 mile walk to the gazeebo on the other resort at the end of the beach - great food, good value and friendly staff. The main downside was our room. Although the room (we had studio above the main lobby) was a good size and had a really, really good view of the beach it was looking quite dated. i.e. lots of beige plastic, couple of sockets not working, scuff marks and scratches here and there and a generous sized bed, but it had seen better days (mattress felt worn and the bedding could be crispier). Also, not a problem for me, but there are no curtains/blinds to the room; the front of which is a large balcony/windows overlooking the beach. However, it was clean and worked well and our 1 year old enjoyed tottering around in it and was happy enough with her crib and waking with sunrise.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Napili”
Reviews.Author: misterevs
Reviews.Content: Wonderful resort and the friendliest, most helpful staff. Stayed in Lahaina 2, room 324 which was beautifully re furbished with every item you could ever want and a great view. Because the place was so great I feel disloyal to state any negatives. But you need to understand this is a remote resort, 36 miles from the airport. The beach is amazing and the resort is on the beach but it's towards the North of the island and thus 1-2 degrees cooler. Because of this we found ourselves taking the local bus (which is cheap, efficient and good) to Kalaahani beach most days where there is less cloud cover. Not much vegetarian choice on menus's. But like I said the resort itself is amazing, staff so helpful, view's perfect and they have a real community feel with info and demo's on Hawaiian customs and so many things were complimentary that despite the few things above stopping the perfect score I would stay here again and recommend this to anyone who wants pure relaxation and a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: ski34days
Reviews.Content: This is not a high rise mega resort, this is a beautiful peaceful Hawaiian resort - a home away from home but better! From the minute you check in till the day you leave they do everything to make it peaceful and relaxing for you. The rooms are very very nice, housekeeping is the best around and the on premises restaurant is of the quality that people come from all around for. The beach is groomed perfectly and the grounds are perfect. Not inexpensive but we wouldn't stay any place else.

Reviews.Title: “Another fantasic stay”
Reviews.Author: BrightonBill
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room #1 in the Lahaina building for a wonderful week October 12 - 19th. Yes we were next door to the "troll" saggy1 had issues with but we got to know him during our first visit and he is not all that bad. Yes if you drag your chairs and table around upstairs it does sound like a heard of elephants have moved in so you really should lift and set it down, simple courtesty. saggy1 could have asked to move I suppose. At any rate we will be back again as this is by far the best place to stay on Maui. The Lahaina building is the original one in this resort (built in the 60's) and is steps from the beach. No A/C but who needs it with the trades blowing through the room. The people working here go out of their way to make you feel like family. From the flower basket and bottle of bubbly on arrival to addressing any and all issues promptly. The daily acitivities are great, we enjoy the putting party the most. I am attaching a few pictures of the room and views just to give you a sense of the place, it is really paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect relaxed atmosphere and location”
Reviews.Author: relaxationseeker0
Reviews.Content: This is not for those who want a high-rise hotel with room service and lots of noise or parties. This is laid-back, family feel, safe for the kids to run all over the grounds and the beach. Secluded, mellow beach with great snorkeling and gentle lapping waves (most of the time) that kids love.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: jenanderson7
Reviews.Content: In 2010, we stayed at the nearby Ritz Carlton and found ourselves packing up each day to go to Napili Bay. This year, to celebrate our anniversary we booked a trip to stay at Napili Kai Beach Resort. We loved it! A special thank-you to Gregg Nelson and his staff for their special touches to make our 14th anniversary a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service, Amazing View, GREAT Prices”
Reviews.Author: PhotoTravelling
Reviews.Content: I've been to a number of beach resorts over the years. Earlier this month, I had the opportunity to stay at the Napili Kai Beach Resort. Let me start by saying I had the most amazing time and I have every intention of coming back here time and time again. First, the front office staff were very accommodating and helpful. Whether it was an activity we wanted to do or a restaurant we wanted to eat at, they were helpful with both suggestions and even making reservations for us (and that's not even part of their job!) Every night, we would go over to the front desk just to talk and get some juice. They were extremely friendly. The first night we arrived, we wanted something to eat immediately -- so we grabbed a table at the Sea House. There was no wait and we were seated almost immediately. My wife got the delicious and succulent lobster and I got the seafood trio -- both were equally amazing. Paired with a great bottle of white wine and some desert for both of us, it was worth every penny we paid for that meal. The ocean-view was spectacular. The sound of the ocean waves lightly crashing in the morning, there's really no better way to wake up in the morning. The beach was clean, pleasant, and always enjoyable. We were able to bring some champagne out to the grassy area right in front of the beach and relax...it was incredible. There are plenty of restaurants nearby in case you don't want to eat at the Sea House and there is plenty of shopping and activities as well. All within 15 minutes driving. Needless to say, 5 out of 5 stars is no where near sufficient for this resort. It should have at least 10 or 15 stars. I highly recommend this resort to anyone looking.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: jcwillis1
Reviews.Content: The Napili Kai is a wonderful place to stay. The staff is friendly and helpful. It is located on Naplili Bay and is a few minutes walk to Kapalua Bay. We stayed in the Puna 2 building with the ocean front location. The rooms are new and very nice. The studio is perfect for a couple. It has plenty of room and the Kitchenette has all you need if you wish to make meals yourself. The view from the room is perfect overlooking Napili Bay and the islands of Molikai and Lanai. The only issue is the late afternoon sun in October is directly into room! The Monday golf putting tournament was fun as is the Wednesday Mai Tai party. Every morning we made coffee and took the Kapalua Bay walking path. They have plenty of beach chairs and is very easy to always have dry beach towels, We will never go anywhere else n Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Better than ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: breeze_of_wind
Reviews.Content: We LOVED our several week stay at Napili Kay. We stayed in Puna 2, which has been completely gutted and refurnished in the last year or so. They did a remarkable job. Our room was comfortable, with a great bed, kitchen area, and a Lanai to die for. Sunsets were spectacular. You sit between two great beaches -- Napili and Kapalua. Snorkeling was great, just sitting on the beach in a comfortable chair under a beautiful palm tree was unimaginable. We had several breakfastes, lunches and dinner at the Sea House -- everything was great. On the last day the hotel provides the opportunity to use a hospitality room for one hour -- no cost (we reserved from 4 to 5). A great idea and this means that there is no problem spending the last day on the beach. I can not say enough about the staff -- all are well trained, friendly, and helpful. As to things to do -- the Kapalua sea walk must be done over and over again, trips to Lahaina are a must, a trip to molokini is great fun on a sailing catamaran, and if you have not been here before the volcano and Hana trips are also a must. As to restaurants, while the prices vary, we went to Kimos many times and loved it each time. Other restaurants of note are Mamas, the Flatbread Company, and Merrimans.

Reviews.Title: “Harrassed by staff member!!”
Reviews.Author: gracie j
Reviews.Content: My family and I decided to have breakfast at the SeaHouse restaraunt at Napili kai. As we finished parking we were greeted from a man who was basically screaming at us from acroos the way.shocked and not knowing if he was referrring to us the man got closer to us and started cussing and yelling..not to mention we had our infant twins and 2 toddlers with us. He was yelling at us saying that this parking was for people dining at the SeaHouse or hotel guests! NOT BEACH PARKING! HIs actions were so un-called for! he wouldnt even listen to what we had to say.. we were so shaken up and scared because obviously this man had no limit of control AT ALL!!! We left immedietly and called the hotel to talk to a manger.. they said no manager was available until 2pm. they apologized and said they would let the manager know. we felt very uneasy and will NEVER COME BACK to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Brian C
Reviews.Content: This would be the perfect hotel if there were air conditioning in the rooms. Other than that the rooms are very nice, the rooms and grounds are kept clean, SeaHouse restaurant is great and the Napili beach is one of the best on the island.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay at Napili Kai”
Reviews.Author: shen60
Reviews.Content: This resort is located on the shore of the very beautiful Napili Bay. I concur with the glowing reviews already published on Trip Advisor. The views are magnificent, the staff is friendly and eager to assist in any way possible, and the grounds are maintained very well. Also, the Sea House restaurant on the premises serves excellent meals. There is something that I'd advise guests to consider, however. We stayed for a week in the building called Keaka I. Rooms are called hotel rooms as opposed to studios or suites which are available in other buildings. This is a building of 12 units, 6 up and 6 down, but the problem is that all rooms are adjoining. There is only a single door connecting your room to the next room and there is a fairly large space beneath the door. The result is that even normal conversations in the next room are heard clearly. It was like being in the room with your neighbors. Fortunately, we were able to be moved to another room where no one was next door and everything was great from then on. So when reserving a room at Napili Kai, pay whatever the extra amount might be for a different kind of accommodation than "hotel room" and avoid having unwanted strangers seemingly in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Inhale, Exhale, Relax”
Reviews.Author: Judy015
Reviews.Content: My husband and my priorities in choosing a hotel and room in Maui were an ocean front (not ocean view) location, a peaceful, relaxed atmosphere, good beach, and within walking distance to a nice restaurant. After 3 trips to Maui, staying at other hotels, we have finally found the place we will be returning to again and again. Napili Kai is not a high rise luxury resort, there is no room service, infinity pools, cabana's, or even valets, but what they do have, in our opinion, is so much better. The resort is located directly on Napili Bay, with gorgeous views of Lanai and Molokai in the distance. The grounds are immaculately kept and spread out, no building is over two stories high. You have easy access to both Napili and Kapalua Bays, two of the most beautiful beaches on Maui. There are 4 small pools which although not fancy are very clean, heated, and have incredible ocean views. You never have to race to get a chair anytime of the day. There are lots of free activities and opportunities to interact with other guests if you choose. The Seahouse restaurant has excellent food (especially breakfast and happy hour), it is reasonably priced and has again, the most beautiful view. It is also an easy walk to two other highly regarded restaurants, Merrimans (expensive/gourmet) or The Gazebo (inexpensive, famous for its breakfast). Our studio in the Puna II building was recently and very beautifully renovated. We had the most incredible ocean front location, probably only 20 feet from the water crashing on the rocks. We spent hours sitting on our lanai, enjoying the comfortable outdoor furniture watching the ocean, the sunrise, the sunset, and the stars (it felt like our own private cabana). The large sliding doors opened up 2/3 of the way across the room giving the entire space an outdoor feeling and allowing in a nice breeze and the sounds of the ocean waves. Even though we didn't cook we appreciated the well equipped kitchenette in our unit for take out, drinks, and snacks. We also really liked have a parking space so close to our unit. These units are not cheap, we paid more than we would have for a room at the Ritz, but in our opinion to be this close to the ocean was worth every penny, and we are saving our pennies up again to return to Napili Kai.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Theguyin4B
Reviews.Content: Napili Kai is blessed with a fantastic location on Napili Bay on Maui. Close enough to the windward side to be green, but out of the wind most of the time. Swiming in the bay is great for all ages. Warm clear water, and shallow a long way from shore. The hotel it self is a very old condo project, with each unit being individually owned. Views are great, but the walls are thin and if you have noisy neighbors you will hear every sound. The best rooms are in Lani I, however the resort will only confirm a reservation in that building 60 days in advance or less. Don't make a reservation for a room in Lani 1 with a promise of "don't worry". If the owners want to use the room, you will be put in a lesser accomidation. Each room is furnished slightly different. The beds are old, The internet has a long cable the snakes around the furniture and the TV's are left over from 1975. So why have I stayed there over 30 times? Location is why. Its a great family vacation place. Load up with food from the Napili market and the kids can play on the beach not far from your room. The resturant and bar are good, but crowded much of the time. Parking is also a problem, but that has become common on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the great reviews! This place in amazing!”
Reviews.Author: richandel
Reviews.Content: We always take reviews on websites such as this one with a pinch of salt as sometimes places seem too good to be true. This one lives up to the hype. If your looking for a high rise ultra modern resort then this isn't for you. What you get for your buck is a little piece of paradise! We were greeted on our arrival with a glass of tropical juice and an "Aloha...welcome home". This place truly felt like a home from home, very chilled out and relaxed. The resort is in the most beautiful bay on the island, totally unspoilt from many of the other beaches along this stretch of Maui which have golf courses, shopping centres and apartment blocks. This had none of that. The complex was built back in the 60's but has a timeless quality and we loved the fact that it wasn't a built up resort. The room was immaculate, very modern and had a full kitchen with everything you could possibly want including ice machine, smoothie maker and coffee machine. They warned us on our arrival that we wouldn't ever want to leave...they were right!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, peaceful, would go again”
Reviews.Author: Deborah C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I felt very blessed to choose NKBR for our 1st 8 day visit to Maui. The other comments on here are right on regarding all aspects of location and hotel. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “We'll keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: andrewjm
Reviews.Content: We've been here before, and we'll be back. Just a beautiful, quiet location on Maui with a fabulous beach. Close to everything, but far enough from the crowds that you can truly relax. Hotel service is excellent, rooms are clean and modern (the Puna II room we stayed in seemed recently remodeled) and the ocean view is perfect. The restaurant is the only tiny quibble we have. Great for breakfast and lunch, but they overreach a little at dinner. With the view and a few Mai Tai's you may not even notice. Anyway, there's lots of excellent dining nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time! We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: KPinLongBeac
Reviews.Content: The hotel was truly a gem; our room was on the first floor next to the main lobby, and for the 7 nights we were there, I cannot find anything substantial to point out that was negative. The beach was about a 45 second walk, the free coffee that was available every morning was the best coffee I have ever had, the happy hour at the resturant on site was affordable and good. We had a room with no air conditioning, but with the ceiling fan and with open shutters, the breeze was perfect. If you are looking for a glitzy resort with butlers at your beach chair, this is not the place. But if you are looking for some old world Hawaiian style accomodations, this is it. There's something very charming and sweet about the entire resort; lemonade at 11:00 at the beach, minature golf right smack dab in the middle of the site, the littel snack bar by the pool...hard to articulate how lovely it all is. The beach itself is one of the most beautiful ones in Maui. We've traveled pretty much all over the world, and the Napili Kai ranks as one of the best places we have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, very special place - authentic, but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: winecountrytravel
Reviews.Content: We returned home last night after a wonderful stay at the Napili Kai - our first visit after staying at Fairmont and Kapalua villas last year. I was a bit concerned about choosing the Napili Kai, but we stayed 9 days and loved it. The motto is "the unhurried way of life" and it is. We stayed in the renovated Puna 2 building in a one bedroom that was really a 2 bedroom - nice galley kitchen, 2 bathrooms, beautiful view of Lanai and Molkai depending on where you sit outside. It was a more expensive room and one with air conditioning and possibly we would have been fine in one of the rooms that have not been renovated. It was a very relaxing and peaceful vacation and we all feel totally rejuvenated. We have stayed at some of the worlds finest hotels and resorts, and although the Napili Kai experience is authentic and understated, but definately not for those who must have over the top amenties. My 12 year old twins were at first disappointed with the small size of the pools and that the hotel wasn't "fancy", but grew to love it and the area. Nice putting green that my son went to every day. We thought the restaurant was OK - expensive for dinner, but lovely setting. We liked the fact that it was a bit cooler and breezier in this part of the island. The one thing that was a bit weird was that there was a matress pad with some plastic on our bed that mad me sweat. We asked that it be changed to a regular matress pad which they did promptly. The hotel said it was a mistake. Loved this part of the island - no highrises, and Puna 2 is between the Napili Beach and the Kapalua beach. Good snorkeling on Napili and even better snorkeling on Kapaua Beach. Saw turtles at both beaches. We loved going to DT Fleming beach just a couple of miles away at the end of the day to play in the waves, but be careful, because it can be rough. Also a bit further north is Slaughterhouse beach - very beautiful, and amazing snorkeling at Honolua Bay - a private marine perserve - no sand, rocks and fantastic snorkeling. You can walk to the Gazebo restaurant down the beach for breakfast and lunch - beautiful views. We did our grocery shopping at Napili Plaza which is just 5 minutes away. The morning talks at Napili Kai under the open tent are very interesting. We love Lahaina so had lunch and dinner there several times. Stumbled upon Aloah Plate which was inexpensive, good authentic Hawaiin food and noodles, and nice views. Time your visit so that you can listen to the music from the Laua next door. We enjoy Cheeseburgers in Paradise right on the water, but they come on too strong with the attempts to sell tee-shirts and other products. Next time I would like to rent a stand up paddle board that many of the guests staying on Napili Bay were using. Rented snorkel equipment from Snorkel Bobs in Napili - note that if you rent more than a week, they charge the more expensive daily rate, not the pro-rated weekly rate on the extra days. We did the Luau Show at the Hilton booked through the Expedia concierge at Napili Kai - kids 12 and under were free, but still expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: boardgirl1220
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely perfect...paradise! The beach is so calm (its a bay) and clean. The pools and jacuzzi were also very clean. Rooms are large and have everything you need...including a kitchen, whirlpool bath and shower. I would recommend staying here...I would definitely stay here again! On site restaurant is great...ate breakfasts and dinners there and was always happy with our meals...and cocktails!

Reviews.Title: “Napili Kai - good traditional Hawaiian hotel”
Reviews.Author: D_Hold
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at Napili Kai twice. It came as a recommendation from a travel agent friend. The first time (11 years ago), we stayed in the Aloha building, in an Ocean View studio. There was no A/C (some buildings have it, others don't), but it had a ceiling fan. We were there in the summer, and while I was fine, my wife likes a chilly room to retreat to and therefore vowed that she would take an A/C room next time. Our second visit (more recently), we stayed in an Ocean Front studio in the Puna 2 building. This time we stayed in an A/C unit. The Ocean Front rooms, do not have safe access to the water immediately in front of the rooms due to the rocks, but in my opinion they had the best views due to the way they are situated (the website has a map where you can check out the building locations. The Beach Front rooms had more direct access to the beach, but the Ocean Front rooms were a simple and quick walk away. The onsite restaurant had decent food - we ate some very nice fish there one night, but we liked going into Lahaina (just 10 minutes away) each night so we did not eat there enough to give an objective opinion. The studio units have a kitchenette (their regular rooms only have a mini-fridge), so you can prepare your own food, if needed. Even though we ate out every night, we enjoy having that option. We typically ate a simple breakfast in the room every day, and if we planned on hanging out locally all day it was nice to be able reheat food and or prepare quick food (and don't forget cheaply!), so we could get back to the pool/beach quickly. The pools weren't anything spectacular, but remember that this is a low-rise, low-key resort. You stay here to avoid the crowds and have an old-fashioned Hawaiian resort experience. The pools served their purpose - taking a dip to cool off. I prefer spending my time on the beach on vacation anyway - I didn't spend all that money to sit at a pool. The beach was nice - there are only a few resorts in Napili Bay, and there is decent snorkeling there. The neighboring beach, Kapalua Bay Beach, has very nice snorkeling and it's very picturesque... only a short 2-3 minute walk away. Napili Bay was still relatively more quiet and laid back, and still a very nice beach. If you are looking for a laid-back more traditional Hawaiian vacation, and want to avoid the crowds of the high-rise or large resorts, I think Napili Kai is definitely worth checking out. 1/2 the people I met there were repeat visitors, and all referred to it as their little secret.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: barking1RedondoBeach
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at this property for many years and have also been recommending it for as long. A great place right on the beach at I think the best beach in the Hawaiian Islands. Very traditional, not fancy but clean and nice. Have a great Children's Luai , serves the best mai Tai's...overall a perfect place to stay:)

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the beach”
Reviews.Author: altalomafolks
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 stayed at Napili Kai for 11 days in late June, early July 2011. We have stayed there before and have enjoyed every stay. Our studio faced the great beach at Npili Bay so we could walk out to enjoy the beach or the fabulous sunsets. The Seahouse restaurant is on the beach too and serves B, L and D. We enjoyed one dinner and 2 dinners of pupus (appetizers) on the deck. The staff at NPK is great. The offer daily programs at the beach cabana with coffee and pineapple juice. Everyone goes out of their way to help. The location can't be beat anywhere on Maui. The kitchenware could use some improvement but everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: jest2good1
Reviews.Content: Napili Kai staff, especially Yvette and Hazel made our family feel very welcome, almost as if we were family. We had two separate rooms. We had a room in the Honolua wing and also on Keaka I. The Honolua was a beachfront studio and we couldnâ€™t have asked for a better room with a view. We had a balcony, and in my opinion, was best so we didnâ€™t have to hear or deal with people walking around, etc. There were 2 chairs for sitting and reading as well as a table with 3 chairs for dining. The lanai had a lounger, 2 chairs and 2 side tables. The room had a kitchen with a full refrigerator and a stove with two burners and the room also came equipped with dishes, silverware, pots and pans, and cooking utensils. It also had a coffee maker and a toaster. We booked this room because we didnâ€™t want to eat out every meal, and it was great for keeping milk, drinks, and some breakfast items and toast. The only thing that we wished the housekeeping staff did was to clean any dishes found in the sink or if it's been washed, to put it away so it would be neat when we got back to our room. We had this service at our last resort and just assumed we'd get it here. The pillows were really soft, but flattened out quickly. But, no problem there, I just asked for more pillows and it was sent within a few minutes. Because of the long flight, we got in late so by the time we got settled and unpacked and ready to hit the beach, the pool cabana was closed. We didnâ€™t want to use our room towels, so once again, no problems there- I just called and the beach towels were sent within a few minutes. My husband and I enjoyed our Honolua room and our friend stayed with our two kids, 4 and 2 years old in the Keaka I building. They had a ground floor room and it overlooked the putting green, pool, and the beach. It was labeled as an Ocean View room and it was that and more. Their lanai was a lot more spacious than ours. The staff was very good at making sure that the crib was ready, made up, and had plenty of sheets and blankets available. This room had a mini fridge, coffee maker, and the bathroom had a separate toilet, shower, and tub area. The tub had Jacuzzi jets! The room was even larger than ours. The tv was a new flat screen model too. The one in our Honolua room, which we found hidden in an armoire was older, but thatâ€™s ok, we werenâ€™t there to watch tv. We initially thought we didnâ€™t have one. Same issue with the pillows, but no worries. The kids enjoyed the sofa that was in the room. The lanai had 3 full loungers and a table. It was quite spacious. The grounds were upkept and beautiful. The kids went on walks very early in the morning to look at the fish in their little pond with a waterfall. Also they had to hurry to pick any flowers because the workers were very diligent in keeping the grounds clean. It became a game to find flowers on the ground. The fitness center was open 24 hours. It was small, with 2 treadmills, 2 steppers, and an exercise bike as well as a nautilus weight machine and a stand of free weights. There was enough room on the floor to pull out mats and stretch out as well. The air conditioning was on and was cold. Towels were also provided and there was a water fountain as well. The steppers, treadmills, and bike had a tv attachment, but I didnâ€™t use it because I just looked out the window and looked at trees, flowers, and the ocean. The Sea House restaurant provided good food, even if the service was a bit slow at times. It wasnâ€™t too much of a problem, because it was beachside and the view and the breeze made up for it. Everyone was nice and friendly. We ate a breakfast, a couple of lunches- quick sandwiches, and a dinner there. I have to say the Philly from Napili was one of the best Iâ€™ve tasted, it was full of lean meat and also came with an au jus. They made their own home fries, which looked like ridged potato chips, but they were better than any store bought chip. A dinner favorite was the crab stuffed prawns (jumbo) and went great with an appetizer called Maui Beach Balls. We ordered two servings. The beach. Lovely to hear the waves as we slept at night. During the day it was nice and not too crowded. Plenty of room to run around, walk, and play with the family. The waves were gentle most of the time. This was a good beach to bring our children to. The water was nice and clear and snorkels were available for free at the Make halo (Iâ€™m sure I spelled that wrong) which provided snacks, putters and balls for the putting green, and towels. Every morning about 10 there would be free tea, coffee, juice, pineapples at a cabana located on the beach. The Napili bay is small, and enclosed and provided wonderful swimming opportunities. A bit further out, there were a lot of colorful fish and turtles around. Other amenities I saw were the spa, but I didnâ€™t use it, and the boutique located next to it. I went in, and it was small, but had a good selection of shirts, dresses, cover-ups, shorts, Hawaiian shirts, sandals, jewelry, and a few drugstore items such as pain relievers and sunscreen. There were items for children as well as men, but mostly for women. The prices werenâ€™t bad comparatively to nearby resorts and stores. The best was the helpful, warm feeling we got from the staff, again Hazel and Yvette, who provided advice from shopping for clothes, groceries, souvenirs, dining, to Bill at the Expedia desk who arranged a wonderful Atlantis submarine tour. Their warmth, friendliness, and helpfulness made our vacation what we envisioned it to be. The resort also helped us out because we had 2 young children who needed naps before we left for our 9:30 PM flight. We were so sad to say goodbye, feeling as if we made good friends. We cannot wait to go back. In fact, last year we were staying somewhere else, was visiting and within 5 minutes of being at Napili Kai wanted to move there. We actually made the decision to come back and to stay at Napili Kai to make sure we werenâ€™t dreaming about how nice it was. Well, we werenâ€™t. It was a nice, relaxing, and wonderful as we dreamed it could be and more. Napili Kai has earned repeat business and loyalty from our family. We will definitely be back next summer.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: sutro
Reviews.Content: Only 2 stories...rooms face the ocean. .beautifully landscaped Good snorkeling, beautiful beach, five star restaurant overlooking beach..outside/inside dining; small gift shop w/clothes, jewelry,misc.; 5 swimming pools, putting green; spa; hula show weekly; slack key guitar show weekly. Beautiful grounds...easy walking to Kapalua, Ritz Carlton, along beach, or sidewalk... Good service.. Long time employees... Home away from home feeling. Concierge to help you with trips around the island or to other islands.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Holly1875
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in the 1990's but have strayed to other properties over the last 10 years or so. On our most recent trip to Maui we booked a room at a Kaanapali hotel and were very disappointed with the service and the way we were handled at check in. On our first evening we stopped by NKBR after dinner next door at Merriman's (delicious food and a fabulous view by the way) to see what their availability and rates were. We were warmly greeted and Michelle at the front desk couldn't have been more pleasant and accommodating. She let us check out two rooms and we were hooked. THIS was the Hawaiian experience we were looking for that was so lacking at the other place. Of course you get what you pay for and the rates were a bit high. Michelle worked some magic though and after speaking with someone in the office behind the front desk she was able to offer us a wonderful discount. Needless to say, we moved from the KB hotel that night! Our five days here were most relaxing. We did practically nothing but read, swim, sun and eat! Napili Bay is one of the most serene places to swim on Maui. The NKBR staff can't be beat; everyone is welcoming and friendly. This is not a place to stay if you're looking to be in the middle of the action. This is a place to kick back, disconnect from the real world (hardly saw anyone on their phones and only 2 people with laptops the whole time) and slow down. We're so happy that our misfortune at our original hotel brought us back to Napili Kai. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical resort-that is a good thing!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTvlAgent
Reviews.Content: BEST location, Beautiful grounds, Friendly, Non " typical square" hotel! Some units are refurbished, some are not. Chose carefully if that is important to you. You will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best.”
Reviews.Author: OKtoGOnow
Reviews.Content: This is by far our favorite property on Maui. If you want to just relax and take it easy and don't want to be bothered by the obnoxious Lahaina crowd then this is the place to go. No whistles and bells, just pure bliss and scenic beauty. The staff is fantastic and the service is great but low key.

Reviews.Title: “There is no place we would rather stay on Maui.”
Reviews.Author: Tresiau
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th visit to Maui and our 5th stay at the Napili Kai Beach Resort. In my opinion it has one of the Nicest beaches on the island. The fact that this is NOT a high rise hotel is what appeals to us. We have enjoyed our stays with and without children. The staff, service, and overall experience is what brings us back . Thank you Kim for making our anniversary trip so special, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Quite lovely - would return in a heart beat”
Reviews.Author: EastBayGermanGirl
Reviews.Content: The Napili Kai is in a beautiful location and somewhat old-fashioned. The entire resort is low rise (as are adjacent properties) and this means that the views from anywhere at the cove/ the beach are quite unspoilt, i.e. you see low buidlings in between palm trees at a beautiful sandy beach/ rock-fringed cove. The water is calm inside the cove, and swimming and snorkeling were great right from the resort beach - there is a little rock reef in the middle of the cove and we saw tropical fish, including quite large blue spine unicorn fish (at least that's what I think those beautiful lime yeallow/green/ blue fish were) and a turtle right there, only yards away from the beach, so the location is great. You have to be aware however, that not all the resort rooms are updated, and you essentially get what you pay for, the choice ranging from non-updated rooms with ocean views at an angle only from their lanai, to beautifully appointed rooms truly on the ocean front and a variety of rooms inbetween (We looked at a few.). The atmosphere is quite sleepy, relaxed and unpretentious. Got the impression that guests were from pretty much all income brackets and backgrounds which made for some interesting people watching. ;-) The service was warm and welcoming, but a little haphazard: cleaning was only so-so, and some details were not always great (no beach towels available in the later afternoon, disappointing drinks at the restaurant bar with barely any alcohol in them but plenty of sugar...), but if you are looking for relaxation amongst natural beauty and can overlook a little less than perfection, I would really recommend it. We certainly want to return, the sooner the better.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: DaisyRoo
Reviews.Content: We've been to Maui many times, and the Napili Kai is by far, our very favorite place to stay. Heavenly location, stayed in a one bedroom suite in the Puna II building. Watched whales and turtles from our lovely lanai. Perfect vacation :)

Reviews.Title: “This place is spectacular!!!!”
Reviews.Author: samjust08
Reviews.Content: I friend told me about the Napili Kai Beach Resort, and I'm so glad she did. My family loved this place. Right on the ocean, amazing views and a wonderful beach. This place has been here since the 1960's, so if you want a degree of luxury, you have to be specific about which building you book. We booked the Puna II building which is on the bluff overlooking the ocean, and just a short 1 minute stroll to the actual swimming beach. I Booked unit 227 which was very recently renovated, and has electric blinds, a/c, large living room with a king bed, sofa, table and chairs, a second bedroom with two singles and a kitchen with full size fridge, small cook top, oven and microwave. It was beautiful. Standing on our balcony we have an amazing view of the beach and the ocean and lost count of the whales we could see after the 2nd day. The pools are smallish, but there are three of them and a huge hot tub, and we never had a problem finding beach chairs, even on weekends. Some buildings are old and badly in need of renovation, so if you want my advice and you want A/C (most buildings don't have it) book Puna II, and request room 227. P.S. The food in the onsite restaurant is wonderful. But try the Plantation house at the nearby golf course. The view is unparalleled in the entire area, and tough pricey, the food is excellent. My favorite restaurant though was the Lahaina Grill in Lahaina. Again, pricey, but exceptional service and wonderful food.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful 30th anniversary, beautiful location, romantic and relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Cherrygirl029
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful location, on its own bay, overlooking the ocean. We were greeted with a glass of passion fruit juice and a smile. Our original room was a beachfront studio but overlooked the pool and putting green more than the ocean. The manager was very helpful and we were able to upgrade to a beautiful oceanfront studio corner unit in Puna II for a bit more money, but well worth it! The oceanfront rooms are worth the extra money, especially if you plan to spend time on your lanai. We watched whales and turtles pass by each morning and evening. The patio furniture has super comfortable cushions and the patio table with chairs is perfect to enjoy drinks or a meal for two. The rooms have been remodeled and are modern with a full mirrored wall that reflects the beautiful ocean view and window shades that are electric, allowing for privacy. Their is a full kitchen, however, their restaurant, the "Sea House" has a great happy hour and breakfast. The prices are reasonable and the food is fantastic, some of the dishes are very creative, authentic hawaiian food. The resort has daily activities from lei making to hula shows and a mai tai reception each Wednesday. The resort has a "homey" "family" feel and everyone greets you with a smile, even the other guests. There are towels, snorkel equipment, small ice chests and other items available at the beach hut for free. I enjoy jogging and there is the Kapalua trail right next to the resort that follows the ocean up to the Ritz Carleton Resort, a great 3 mile roundtrip. This is not a large, spread out resort with lots of space. It is a small slice of paradise and great if you just want beach time and a beautiful ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “Restful Nights, Lazy Days”
Reviews.Author: Jon M
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Maui, but not to the Hawaiian Islands. I was nervous about booking a place, so I asked around. Many folks recommended the Napili Kai. As you have read in many reviews on this site, people found the rooms to be outdated. I can only review the room that I stayed in, which was in the building called "Puna II". It was totally renovated, with op to date appliances and furniture. Everything was new, and it was quite lovely. We enjoyed our room immensely, and it was cleaned neatly every day we were there. We even made our bed, and each day the maid re-made our bed! LOL. Anyway, it was a great room, #240, which was on the second floor, on the corner of the building. It had an incredible view, and since it was on the corner, we got an extra wide view of the ocean from two fronts. Excellent! We really enjoyed sitting out on the large patio, overlooking the beautiful Pacific. We saw whales and a sea turtle not far out to sea from our patio. The pools are right below, so you can go swimming in relative quiet if you want, instead of going to the Pacific. The lounge chairs were rarely used, and we never had problems finding empty ones. The beach is near enough that it is convenient, and far enough where you don't get the noise from the beach crowd. The beach is gorgeous, and the water is so nice and not too cold. Snorkeling was great, but best when you swam to the right side of the beach (west) and went up around the point. It was great out there. Be careful of the reef in the center of the bay as I nearly got stuck on it. I didn't realize it was so high! We did not try any of the restaurants, as we had stopped at Costco at the airport and bought all of our food to cook ourselves which we greatly enjoyed. The restaurants looked good, and the food looked good, but as always in Hawaii, overpriced. The kitchens in the units are fully stocked with everything you will need, so no need to worry about that. There are barbecues below near the pool for everyone to use also. We loved cooking in our kitchen. One of the more beautiful aspects of this hotel is its location which is so lovely. You can walk west from the hotel and walk nearly two miles, right on the beach, past the Four Seasons and see some marvelous sites on the shore. Also if you walk up two more miles there are some great snorkeling beaches off of the 30 highway. There are hardly any people there too. Worth the walk or drive. The only negative thing I have to say about this hotel is that the staff at times seemed unfriendly, like they really didn't like their jobs, or were just in a bad mood. I know it's a job and not many people like their jobs, but you could at least fake it. Especially at the towel cabana, I felt like I was putting them out and "making them work", or just annoying them when I asked them to change my towel. Our maid was very friendly however, as was the young lady who checked us in, she was quite personable. Overall, this is a very nice hotel, well worth the price, especially if you stay in the Puna II building. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “If Only the Entire Resort Were Updated.....”
Reviews.Author: rickstarke
Reviews.Content: This little "gem" of a location must've represented nirvana in its heyday - gorgeous setting, tasteful & unobtrusive layout of the grounds and all amenities - probably really top-notch about 50 years ago. Unfortunately, the unit provided to my wife and me was maybe a 7 on the 1-10 scale, since it's winter (no A/C). It'll be no better than a 6 by mid-summer. Although we were shown about 4 other units in different buildings for possible relocation, (and the very sweet, helpful reservations girls were extremely accommodating in their attempts to assist), 3 of the 4 were worse than our original unit. Whether it was the uninspired, dated decor, the moldy smells, or spartan mattresses, we kept thinking there was "nothing that a multi-million dollar upgrade couldn't fix" in order to return the old gal to her former splendor. Only one unit was what we would call outstanding - a recently and thoroughly updated unit (A/C included) that would slam-dunk a 9-10 rating. Once again (unfortunately), we were booked for 6 nights and this unit was only available to us for the first 2 of them, so it hardly seemed worth the complications. At least the unit we decided to stick with wasn't moldy and had been about 70% updated. It's a real shame. The exceptional location tempts you to stay and play, but the reality for us was that we found ourselves wanting to escape the accommodations for the day, returning only at night for a place to bathe and sleep. Bottom line is, if you can book a stay in the Puna 2 building, go for it! You'll love it and you'll never know what the masses are suffering. Otherwise, don't set your expectations too high and you'll probably be OK.

Reviews.Title: “Abosolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: polarlgirl5
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay Napili Kai, fifth to Maui. Napili Kai is by far the best place we have stayed on the island to date. The location is perfect, within a stones throw of awesome snorkeling at Kapalua Bay, the snorkeling in Napili Bay is good too, saw a few turtles in the bay during our stay. Great views of whale breaches from our room and the beach. There is a lovely walking trail (Kapalua beach trail) next door. The staff is completely friendly, easy going and helpful. The daily events I expected to be cheesy - which they were of course, but the guests and staff (Many of the guests while we were there have been visiting Napili Kai since the mid 1960's - that in itself speaks volumes) are all so friendly it was a 'hoot'. The pools, public areas, and beach were all clean and not overly packed with people. The Sea House retaurant is nice - we didn't have any full meals there but enjoyed the pu-pu's and happy hour libations on a few occassions.

Reviews.Title: “A Slice of Heaven in Maui”
Reviews.Author: DHFolsom
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the people and the accommodations of Napili Kai. The "Napili Kai 'Family' " that we met were outstanding as well. This group of approx. 60 guests have been gathering at Napili Kai for over the past 20+ years at the same time each year. As first timers, we were taken in by the "Family" as new members and had a great time. The facility was created in 1960 and a major part of the overall feel was established and that is that the guests were to be treated as "family".. We can only tell you that the "family feeling" has been maintained up through our visit. It was a great visit and very hard to leave when our departure date arrived. The resort does not have any buildings over two stories high and is very relaxing with breath taking views from the lanai (balcony) where we looked at the bay and ocean through palm trees, etc.. We had a kitchen that included virtually everything...dinnerware, serving pieces, cutlery, microwave oven, refrigerator, dishwaster, stove/oven, etc. The only thing that we would like to see added would be a ceiling fan for the lanai (balcony). While the room did not have a/c, the ceiling fan worked just fine in making us comfortable. The two Puna buildings have air conditioning and are right on the ocean. We looked at some rooms in both of the buildings and found that one has been refurbished and was just outstanding. The other one is scheduled for a refurbishing sometime this year if I am not mistaken. Our lanai (balcony) had 2 lounge chairs and a small table as well as two additional chairs with another little table. There was enough room on the lanai to bring out the table from the main room & two chairs when we had guests over. As mentioned above, the view from the room was outstanding. At night you would hear and see the waves with their white crests come rolling in to the beach. You could also see Molokai from our lanai. What a way to wake up in the morning or close out the night... SO RELAXING ! ! The grounds are beautifully maintained. The staff (everyone > reservation staff, counter staff, recreation staff, house keeping, etc ) made us feel like we were part of their family. Several of them have said that their jobs at Napili Kai were the best that they have ever had and that they are treated as "family" by their management. Quite an endorsement. We even met the person who set up our reservations. She has been there 18 years..she loves it there... The resort also created a special Non Profit Foundation for the children of the employees... Great program and the various shows that they put on at night help support it throughout the year... The resort has daily events that are a little different than normal... daily 10am get together with fruit drink, coffee, and pineapple slices while at the same time experiencing different cultural events (basket weaving, lei making, coconut husking, etc.) that were very interesting. Monday night Putting contest w/ .50 cent drinks, Wed nites the hotel hosts a free Mai Tai party where you can mingle with the other guests and get to know each other AND MUCH MORE... Great social events ! ! To sum it up, we plan on going back to the Napili Kai on a regular basis and especially in February to visit with our family again. We have never had such a relaxing and fun vacation as the one we just experienced at the Napili Kai.

Reviews.Title: “Worst decision ever”
Reviews.Author: tnpaulson
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip for my honeymoon and realize that I made a terrible mistake. The service is horrible. I am met with an attitude and laziness everywhere I go. On top of that, the server delivered jam to my table for breakfast. Thank you for all of the ants that were included with the jam. That was appetizing. We tipped our housekeeper as we always do, only to find that the three dishes in the sink aren't done so we now have ants crawling everywhere. She doesn't even replace the wash cloths in the same place she put them the day before. It will be a nice little scavenger hunt finding the wash rags. The food itself is terrible. I ordered scrambled eggs and got a yolky sloppy mess. I am continually met with an attitude by almost everyone I deal with. Meanwhile, anyone with dark skin is met with a smile and welcome. This place is racist. Absolutely racist.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place”
Reviews.Author: skleis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to this resort for 10 days. We had been to Maui in the past and stayed at resorts closer to Lahaina. Last year we stayed at the Sheraton and loved it. We did not think any resort would be better than the Sheraton and the Sheraton's location. But we were wrong. We enjoyed the Napili Kai Resort. Yes, it is alittle out of the way but not that far. About 15 minute drive to Lahaina. Since we enjoy just hanging around the pool and beach, this was the perfect place. However, if you like to venture out, they have someone at the resort to help plans events. And you are not that far from things. Why we liked this place better than staying at the Sheraton, and the other resorts near that area. 1. No parking fee. Also, our parking area was a 1 minute walk from our room. Easy for carrying groceries. 2. No fee for use of lounge chairs on the beach. No problems finding a chair. 3. There is a 3 mile walking trail next to the Napili Kai, that takes you along the coast. We saw beach weddings every night around 5pm. 4. Having a kitchen and grills saves you so much time and money. 5. Many small pools. In fact, my husband and I would hang out by one of the pools and we had the place to ourselves. You had the pool behind you and the ocean in front of you. Perfect. 6. Nice staff 7. The snorkeling was not as nice as the black rock by Sheraton but we found the best spot to see lots of turtles. Walk down the Napili beach, past the other Napili resorts until you get to the point where there are black rocks. There is a path along these black rocks. Take this until you get around the point to a cove. The black rock path will lead you to the sidewalk of another resort. About a 5 minute total walk. Where shoes. You will then find this cove where there are dozens of giant sea turtles. You will see the signs stating to stay away from the turtles. Perfect for snorkeling. Jump in the water and you will see dozens of giant sea turtles. Well worth it. The only compliant we had was the service at the resort restaurant was slow. It took awhile for them to take your order and to get the bill. I would recommend this place and we will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Maui wowie!!”
Reviews.Author: PurplePearls
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 days in this great resort during their 50th Anniversary, with our 11 year old daughter. It was relaxing and fun with activities every day if you wanted to join in either at 10 am or later in the day. Enjoyed an amazing children's mini luau show put on by the Napili Kai Foundation. The staff were great, location amazing, beach phenomenal cove like bay area with excellent snorkelling including numerous turtles!! Would recommend to anyone looking for an authentic "Maui" experience. ALOHA!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Trip to Napili Kai”
Reviews.Author: Oregonroadtripper
Reviews.Content: This resort was a little "out of the way" but we loved that about it. The nearest real tourist area- meaning mall shops and big food stores were about 15 minutes. Because of that you are in a very, very quite area. Pristine beach with walk in snorkeling. Had a oceanview studio and it was good- small kitchen but grills right out side. Big Lanai. Fantastic view from room. Parking was free and ok. They gave us a hang tag for the car so that they could make sure only guests parked, many days we had to park far and half of the cars had no tag. I don't think they ever check. Brought our own towels because we had read complaints. Got theirs anyhow as we were approched by workers telling us this is the only way the can verify guests only are using beach chairs *sigh* we had no problems with them though. Good laundry facilities. Used maid service about everyother day. One day left her tip where she did not see it and room not nearly as clean- made me a little sad but I guess I understand- must be frustrating. Only went to Seahouse resteraunt once. It was a great location, but...well, we felt like outsiders, went for early breakfast and it was clear the other families had been many times and were treated way different. Did not go back. Will return to this resort in a heartbeat as all the bad was not bad- just how it is and all the good was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach, Excellent Views, Wonderful West Maui Location. Felt like Hawaii.”
Reviews.Author: Humulus51
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Napili Kai Beach Resort. This time we stayed in the Puna Point building which is on the tip of the point, at the far northern end of Napili Bay. One bedroom, two bath suite. Views from the room were incredible. The room itself is somewhat outdated, but was very clean, and daily housekeeping was prompt. I was told by some other guests that they had planned on updating all the rooms in Puna Point this year, but delayed it because of last year's shaky visitor economy. Last year we stayed in a great studio in the Aloha wing that had been more recently updated. The Puna 2 building was completely renovated and modernized last year. We didn't want the mega-resort, all glass and chrome feel, so we love NKBR. Wicker furnishings with great breezes through the unit. Napili Bay is a great location, one bay south of Kapalua. Takes about 15 minutes to drive south to Kaanapali and Lahaina Town. Go north and you'll find several other great beaches for snorkeling/swimming. The beach is one of the best swimming beaches around. Keep in mind it's not a desolate, remote beach, though, so expect others to be there. Check out the webcam on the NKBR website. I'm convinced there are no bad rooms at Napili Kai; some have just been renovated more recently. The resort is very quiet, and not recommended for those looking for Cancun style nightlife. (Try any Kaanapali resort for that!). The resort's Sea House restaurant was generally excellent, and not gaspingly expensive (compared to other places on the island). Best dinner view, and lots of al fresco dining also available. If your budget can stand it, make sure to try Merriman's Maui restaurant for real high end dining; about a 3 minute walk from Napili Kai. We're already planning a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Beach Front View!”
Reviews.Author: Soozelander
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed in one of the newly renovated buildings with an ocean front. The view was amazing! The Napili Kai was grandfathered in by building so close to the ocean because they have been in existence for 50+ years. Once it started eroding they built up around it using rocks and it is a gorgeous view now! Napili Kai attracts an older crowd. Some people have been coming there for 30 years! It has been kept up very nicely (although I didn't see any other room types) and they have the leg up when it comes to ocean front and mature landscaping. The grounds are taken care of meticulously. The whole experience was fun. They have a restaurant on the grounds and at the time of check-in my 4-year old son was given a wrist band so that when we go to the restaurant he can eat free if I order an entree so that was a great deal! Everything in the hotel is complimentary and there are no resort fees! The scuba gear & golf putters, to mention a few things, were complimentary. There's hot tubs, numerous pools, shuffle boards and they have activities planned every day! On their website it lists all their daily activities. Their slogan is Discover the Unhurried Way of Life and that's definitely what you get. At check-in we were offered Pog juice and the bellhop drove us and our luggage via golf cart to our room giving us a tour along the way. It was very relaxing and so nice that so much was included!

Reviews.Title: “I Really, Really Wanted to like this Place!”
Reviews.Author: PattyNewportBeach
Reviews.Content: After staying over the years at many condos/resorts on Maui I finally decided to give this one a try. We stayed in a one bedroom in the Puna Point building and thank goodness we got a special of half off or we would have probably demanded our money back. We did have air conditioning so that was good. The room itself really was nothing better that what you would find at a Motel 6. Old and funky and strangely depressing. The patio was really nice but our neighbors were so loud that we couldn't even begin to enjoy sitting out there. There is only a thin divider between patios...great if you like to evesdrop! They were so loud we had to have our air conditioning fan on high the whole night to get some sleep. Not what you are looking for at $500.00 a night. This resort is all about the beach. We loved the beach at Napili...it is outstanding! The restaurant is very nice and the staff friendly. The grounds are very pretty but they hide the fact that the buildings need serious updating. There are many better options nearby (like the villas at Kapalua) that charge less and are sooooo much nicer. My advice: go to the beach for the day, maybe have lunch at the restaurant...but unless you want to spend your hard earned money at a sad, old, tired resort please stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort on gorgeous Napili Bay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: AshleyK912
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to Maui for our wedding and honeymoon. I highly recommend Napili Kai Beach Resort for honeymooners and even families too! The resort staff were very knowledgeable and helpful throughout the planning of our trip. The resort is situated on a beautiful bay, making it the perfect location for our destination wedding on the bluffs overlooking the bay. The snorkeling in the bay is fabulous and the views from the resort are incredible. The rooms were spacious and clean, although the decor was somewhat dated. I could not have asked for a more comfortable and enjoyable experience! While we didn't take advantage of any of the activities the resort had to offer, the calendar was filled with different activities every day. If you are planning a Maui vacation, wedding or honeymoon...this is a GREAT choice for hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl29987
Reviews.Content: This place is what I think a Hawaiian vacation should be. It's got two great snorkeling beaches and the best sunsets ever. The only drawbacks are that I wish there was a gas bbq near the Punta bldgs, and I wish there were other places to get your towles besides the beach cabana that was a little bit far from us. I really loved the polynesion feel the place has and will return again as well as reccommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: lr670934
Reviews.Content: Napili Kai Beach Resort is a real paradise, a beautiful hotel near a wonderful beach, without too many waves, which is good if you like swimming... And there is also the reef!!! Nice place, nice service and awesome vieuws on the ocean. The restaurant is simply delicious! We will come back for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “We stayed in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: CarolJ64
Reviews.Content: After spending one week in Waikiki, the Napili Bay was exactly what we were looking for. As soon as we walked into the lobby we felt comfortable. The welcome from front desk seemed very genuine and they took time to tell us about upcoming activities. Our room was a suite in the Aloha building and the view was incredible. Even though we didn't have a/c, we were still cool enough at night to sleep - other than the first night. We didn't realize that we could adjust the fan speed... We loved the fact that we could cook for ourselves and took advantage of the BBQ several nights. The first night we arrived we tried the Sea House Restaurant and found the food to be very good - albeit a bit pricey. The concierge was able to set us up for several great tours - the Haleakala bike trip and a snorkeling cruise/sail to the island of Lanai. We would highly recommend both. The rest of the time we just laid back at the resort. There is enough to do so you don't get bored. A couple of the activities we participated in was the Putting Party and the Mai Tai Party. This gave us an opportunity to mix and mingle with other guests. It's not a matter of "if" we will be back - it's "when".

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Shivel
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at Napili Kai Beach Resort. The resort was beautiful, grounds immaculate and the beach-wow! We booked a beachfront studio-great option. It had a full kitchen and huge lanai with a perfect view of Napili Bay. We got an AC room since I was afraid of the no AC option but it probably wouldn't been too bad.The tradewinds were pretty strong at night. The best part of the resort was the location. Nearby Honolua Bay has incredible snorkeling. We swam with turtles and all kinds of tropical fish. Nearby Kannapali and Lahaina have great restaurant options. I didn't mind the low key style of the resort-it isn't too decorated but who needs that in Hawaii? The staff was so friendly and helpful. Like I said, you are in paradise so why complain? We had an incredible time and I highly recommened this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: CalBears
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in Napili Kai once last year and again this year. You can't beat Napili beach specially for young children. It's a beautiful bay, the waters are calm and flat and there's some good snorkeling available. I have to agree with some reviews that the rooms are looking old and terribly out of date. It looks like they haven't done a re-model since the 90's. We booked a one bedroom suite on Puna Point which was spacious with a living room, 2 bathrooms and a separate bedroom ($250 for a one bedroom). The kitchen area was small but adequate for preparing simple meals. The bedroom was fairly large enough to accommodate a crib without feeling cramped. Despite these positives, the brown/beige tile, the pink bathtub, and the formica counter tops really needs to go. So we spent most of our time out on the lanai since the views were just spectacular! Oh, and they have this ridiculous towel policy where you have to basically watch your towels like a hawk because if you manage to leave one at the beach and can't account for it, you get charged $20!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff and old rooms...”
Reviews.Author: Oceanside4
Reviews.Content: We booked for my wife's birthday and our 12 year anniversary. I usually give good reviews, but this time we were very disappointed. We booked through Pleasant Holidays first and were told our rooms would be right on the beach. Not exactly. We can live with that. Checking in we found the staff to be unfriendly and short which did not change our entire 8 days. Living on an island and seeing thousands of people gets old I am sure. Our rooms were on the older side. The free in room Internet access is hard-wired and not wireless. (Our computers are iPadâ€™s so we could only use the Internet in the lobby). The rooms had a rustic and moldy smell. Place was built in the sixties so you can imagine how old the rooms were. Wife found various bugs inside our room - gross. We didnâ€™t make a stink about it to the resort because we were either at the beach or traveling the island. We primarily used the room to rest and eat. We were looking for an experience and did not receive it from the resort. Staff just wasn't friendly - sorry. Snorkeling, beach access, surrounding areas were beautiful. We absolutely loved Lahaina. So amazing and elegant. Great food and fun. Make sure you check out the Banyan Tree Park - unique. Stop at Costco on your way in and fill your fridge. Food on the island can be expensive when you have kids. Hope your experience was better.

Reviews.Title: “watch out for no a/c and smokers”
Reviews.Author: BostonDenver
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've ever given a 1-star review so let me explain - the room didn't have a/c so we had to have the windows open, then the Loud family from texas decided to have a party in their room next door and we heard every word and laugh through the open windows, and then we discovered that the smoking tent was right below our balcony so we got all the smoke. I called the front desk and they didn't respond. And then in the middle of the night I was woken up by a group having a party on the beach. I didn't sleep much that night. The next day, after a little discussion the front desk eventually let me switch rooms (but said only because I booked directly with them?). We then got a very nice remodeled room with a/c that was farther on the point and was quiet and beautiful. (and they charged me an "upgrade" price) It's too much of a risk to stay here after traveling all the way to Hawaii - you might get an awesome room or you might get one that sinks your vacation. Napili beach is fantastic and fun and this is probably the nicest place on Napili Bay. Next year, we're staying somewhere else and will just visit the beach for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Location trumps all”
Reviews.Author: Missymoreno
Reviews.Content: We planned a last minute (hence expensive) family vacation to Maui and opted for a 2 bedroom suite at the Napili Kai, over a large suite at the Ritz and double suites at the Kea Lani. We chose the Napili Kai for it's low key, low rise appeal, and the unbeatable beach access. The bay is gorgeous, friendly & safe for young kids swimming. There are lots of activities, and quite a few other restaurants within walking distance-for a small area there's lots to see and do. The excellent Sea Horse Restaurant has a varied menu-all delicious with huge portions, all day drinks, and free kids menu meals-with a fun mix of locals and guests mingling at the bar. At that moment, with the sand in your toes, and the tropical winds blowing, a mai tai in hand, the ukelele player and his buddies singing charmingly off key, whole place is magical. But it took awhile to get there. We arrived to find our suite unavailable(almost $700 a night for one weeks' stay, normally $820)-the A/C was leaking and the roof was sagging due to water weight. The AC we had specifically requested having read all the reviews of how hard it was to sleep without it -either due to noise, or humidity. Given a choice of 2 non connecting one bedrooms (not great to split up with small kids) at the far end of the property, or a one bedroom with sleeping area (separated by shoji screens from the LV RM) but without AC-we went with the later. The room in Puna Point had great views with a nice grassy area in front. But for 4 nights we slept uncomfortably with fans going, in hot, stuffy rooms, and a cast of unsupervised teenagers hanging out in the adjacent pool until all hours. The staff made some attempts to shut down their festivities, but mostly, they just moved on to another pool, or the beach. By the 5th night our suite was 'ready"-we packed up and moved 3 adults , 2 kids, beach paraphernalia, and kitchen of food.
