The Ohana suite (feels like a 70's condo unit with lots of fake potted plants) is enormous, with a washer/dryer, 2 separate BR's and baths, a balcony, and finally, AC! We arrived to find maintenance people working on the living room blinds for 3 hours. It felt very much like the unit was under renovation. The staff were very apologetic and offered a $400 credit, but it certainly didn't feel like we got the room we booked and paid handsomely for, until the last 3 nights of our stay. Normally, we wouldn't recommend a place that so casual about it's obligations, especially at this price, but there are so many other wonderful qualities: the location, the history, the interesting repeat clientele, and the chance to mingle with families of 3 generations all vacationing together.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - a slice of paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Holland-Hawaii
Reviews.Content: We were advised in regard to a number of properties by a local expert on accommodation and activities on Maui, Donna Bender. She had given us information on a range of possible properties which considering our wishes could have fit the bill, the Napili Kai running to the more upscale side of the spectrum. Although the price was at the upper range of our comfort zone, once there we never once second guessed our decision to pick the NKBR, it was absolutely worth every penny, truly fabulous. The location, the rooms, the "just outside the door" proximity of the perfect beach on Napili Bay and the overall low-key "Aloha" feeling that the place exudes all contributed to a fantastic experience for the whole family. Our kids, 12 and 14, were able get out directly to the beach, coming and going as they pleased. The elimination of the logistics in organizing this was great, and since the beach the hotel is on is an A+, the relaxation factor was maximized. Via short car trips it was a great launching place to visit Lahaina, and all the snorkel beaches on that part of the island. All in all, our time there was perfect, and we wished we could have stayed forever. Many thanks to Donna Bender whose advice on this hotel was great. She was prompt, responsive and thorough, and really helped us pick the facilities that best met the needs of our family. She even threw in a FREE copy of her â€œLocal Girlâ€™s Guide to Mauiâ€�, which is chock full of tips on Maui's hidden gems, including fun spots and an eating out guide that really maximized the short time we had. The NKBR was a true 5-star experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: JulieJoyRN
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to get a beach view 2 queen bed room with a great lanai. The ocean breeze was wonderful. Rooms were clean, staff nice. Napili bay is right there and calm enough for the kids to play in daily. They snorkled and swam morning and then evening when we got home from site seeing. Our room did not have air conditioning but they provided fans for us. Again, we were lucky that the ocean breezes came into our room so we were never that warm. It was perfect and a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I never wanted to leave.....felt like home, well better!”
Reviews.Author: HuskerTX
Reviews.Content: I arrived with some reservations about the property based on past reviews. Upon checking in, I was not loving anything. Towel cards, parking spots, hanging tags for the car. The flight was long and I needed sleep. In the morning, the beauty of the property found a place in my heart, and made me feel like I was at home. This was the someplace I needed to be. The staff was wonderful. They truly love the place they work, it shows in how the guests are treated. The food at the Sea House is good for breakfast. We did not love dinner, and only ate dinner that one time. The rooms were much better then I thought they were going to be, I am a very picky person and I was OK with it all. I am VERY,VERY HAPPY WE GOT THE AIR CONDITIONING. I WOULD HAVE BEEN A MESS WITHOUT IT. One really great thing that the property does not mention, they save the left over boggie boards for the kids to play on and they save the sun umbrellas form guest that have left them. That was great, my daughter had a booggie board and I did not have to pay forty dollars for it at the store. And I also got a sun umbrella, fair skin needs shade. The beach chairs were very comfy to sit in. I did not think I would like those either. Loved them! One other tiny,tiny thing is the sound proofing between the rooms. We could hear everthing being said by the folks next door. That is the only thing that needs to be improved, the only thing. We were in room number 27. If you stay at Napili Kai take a moment to learn the history of the resort. It in it self is amazing. The foundation show put on on Tues is wonderful. The money supports the kids of the Napili Foundation. It is worth watching. Kids and Tweens will love it. The beach is great, the kids will love it and you will love it, but take fins if you are going to snorkel. They have the masks but you need fins to really enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Back After All These Years”
Reviews.Author: kaddyshak
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to be sent by a travel agent to Napili Kai Beach (Club) Resort on our very first visit to Maui some 26 years ago and we fell in love with Maui through that visit. We returned to Napili Kai for the first time in many years in 2009 because our son had been there with us years ago and vowed that he would only bring his wife (then his girlfriend) to Napili Kai on her first visit to Maui. We have been to Maui 25 times over the last 26 years and only stopped staying Napili Kai because Kapalua initiated a golf package around 1991 that was just too good to pass up . . . of course all good things come to an end so we looked for another reasonably priced golf option . . . found it at Pukalani Country Club Golf Course in Pukalani. In the last few years we have stayed in Pukalani to take advantage of the golf there having found a really nice condo right off the 16th fairway at the golf course through Vacation Rentals By Owners (VRBO). Once again we fell in love with Napili Kai in 2009 and are returning there in 2010 . . . we will go there after some golf in Pukalani and spend the last week of our vacation at Napili Kai. When we were there last year they were just finishing the updating of one of the Puna buildings and the Puna Point building where we, our son & his wife stayed in adjoining units was scheduled for updating shortly after we left . . . so . . . those of you who have written negative reviews about the accomodations should maybe check on the updating progress if you were not satisfied with same during your visit there. All in all I cannot imagine a more relaxing place with wonderful employees, fine accomodations, great activities, excellent restaurant, lovely grounds and one of the best beaches with protected snorkeling that you could find. As you can tell, we love this place and are really looking forward to returning again this year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and activities director”
Reviews.Author: CathyDoreen
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at Napili Kai. It is such a gem of a location - one of the best on the island. The views, the beach and the amenities offered by hotel are outstanding. We also had the pleasure of meeting with the activiities director, Holland Carter. He was very knowledgable and enthusiatic about all the island has to offer. We have to come back to Napili Kai to do all of the fun things Holland has suggested.

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of heaven”
Reviews.Author: Pettifogger101
Reviews.Content: If you like an island trip where you have constant adventure and large swimming pools with beautiful people....skip this place. If, on the other hand, you want to have the most relaxing and magical old Hawaiian experience then this is your place. It's not cheap, it's not swank...heck, the beds are not even that comfortable. But we got a room right on a 5 star beach with a lanai that becomes private grass where we would watch the sun rise and set. Snorkeling, turtles, boogie boarding, mellow small crowds and the smoothest trade winds. Ahhhh....we will be back! Don't bother blowing a ton on dinners. Eat your lunch and dinner in your kitchen and hit the tiny Maui Taco for dinner...yum!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: drago76
Reviews.Content: Great location! We stayed in the Puna II building that was newly renovated. Couldn't have asked for a nicer room. The location was perfect. 2nd floor ocean front with the best view! What really makes this a special place are the incredible staff. They truly do make you feel like family and you are "home". The first thing they say to you at check-in is "Welcome home". When we return, we will only stay at Napili Kai Beach Resort!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Cowboylarry13
Reviews.Content: Excellence with the true Hawaiian graciousness of Maui. I have never received such incredable customer service, the food was outstanding, and my room was grand. I love the Nalili Kai and when I come back to Maui I will only stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Low key, decent little resort”
Reviews.Author: BTGeekboy
Reviews.Content: It's worth noting that this place was originally called the Napili Kai Beach Club, and later renamed to "Beach Resort" due to confusion about who it was available to. It really is a low-key, very quiet group of rooms. No building is over two stories tall, so look elsewhere for you skyscraper fans. There's tons of reviews here already, so I'll limit mine to things I haven't yet seen or disagree with. We stayed in a Keaka room, with air conditioning, while my girlfriend's parents stayed in another building which did not. I'm not sure about the necessity of it, though - we used it to dry out the air of the room much more than cool it down, as it reached about 70F each night. It wasn't a huge deal when we were in the other room. If you're from a much cooler climate, you may want it, but I hail from Southern California, where temperatures can reach well above the usual 85F found here. It should also be mentioned that the Keaka room I stayed in was much larger than a standard hotel room - the lanai was huge, bathroom was similarly huge with separate jacuzzi tub and shower, and the king bed didn't take up nearly all the space in the room. The bed was two twins pushed together, which reminded me of a cruise ship bed - not hugely thick or pillow-topped, but there was a box spring, and it was plenty comfortable. I've had hotel beds much worse. I laughed when I saw others complaining about the resort rules. Really, they're common courtesy, and not difficult to follow. Want proof? Here they are, summarized: don't hang bathing suits and towels over lanai railings (they'd probably blow away anyway), don't put grease or bones down the garbage disposals, only use the resort BBQs - not your own, don't remove pool furniture, age restrictions on the hot tub - nobody under 16 after sunset (adult swim? Heck yeah), quiet hours 10p-8a, no pets, don't touch the coral reef, don't store bikes/etc in hallways, no fireworks, don't shortcut through [meticulously maintained & beautiful] shrubbery, and don't take home rocks/sand/coral. That's it. In exchange for following those simple rules, things like towel service, sporting equipment (croquet, bocce, putters & balls, snorkel gear) are free of charge, which was a pleasant surprise. If I could change one thing, this geek would like to have an ethernet cable that was 10' longer so that it reached out to the lanai. Seriously, the one time I didn't bring an cable with coupler, I wanted it. Oh well, that's hardly a complaint. Other geeks may be interested to know that the bandwidth appears to be 1mpbs/384kbps per person, which is horrible on the mainland, but reasonable if you look up the cost and bandwidth available to island residents. I don't really know whether it's a decent value or not, as I got it as part of a air/hotel/car combo from Costco. If I do my math properly, and guesstimate on the value of the car and airfare, I'd say we paid about $1600 for 8 nights. Sounds reasonable, though I can't compare to other resorts. It's calm, it's quiet, and I'm not looking forward to going home in a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: GeeDub411
Reviews.Content: This is old Hawaii at it's finest. Low rise buildings, and wonderful location on it's own private bay over looking Lanai and Molikai. Doesn't get any better. Stay 2 weeks and go home in a state of total relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful unique beach location, friendly guests, clean but dated"”
Reviews.Author: CMCPortland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a one week "babymoon" here. We have been to Oahu and Kauai and still like Kauai best but we really enjoyed this hotel and the location on Maui (much better than Kanapali!) Maui is very dry and being up at the NW end of the island was more lush (more like Kauai), but also very windy in the afternoons! It was fine for us because it kept it from feeling too hot. We also got some rain showers once in awhile in the late afternoon but they only lasted a few minutes. It was not a big deal. This can be common on the islands. For the Hotel: The LOCATION on the beach is hard to beat and every room has an ocean view although some are better than others. We had a room with a mini fridge but without a kitchenette, next time I would get one with a kitchenette so we would have more freedom to eat in our rooms (eating out gets soo $$expensive). This hotel is owned by shareholders. As such, there are usually a handful of them hanging out there. They are very friendly and make the place feel more like a time-share than a hotel. The ROOMS are clean and very spacious but a bit dated. They could really stand to replace the old-school itchy bedspreads, and blankets with soft european lightweight duvets & duvet covers -and get some new beds (not very firm). Flatscreen TVs would be a nice update and I would have liked knowing ahead of time that there was a DVD player in the room! The BATHROOMS are pretty plain/ugly but gigantic and clean. Its Hawaii after all, they could add some pretty colored walls and art work to make them feel more spa-like. They do have jetted tubs AND stall showers! A few more hooks all over the place would be helpful!! The lanai/balconies are large with chairs out there and views. No hanging things over the rail though, you have to drape them on your chairs. Here are some more PROS: ~ 18 hole FREE Putt-Putt golf is a blast. My husband played every day. Also has a smaller kiddie course for the kids. These both have ocean views. ~ Free coolers & ice to borrow during your stay ~ Free morning coffee in the lobby ~ Nice size beach towels ~ No resort fees or parking fees ~ NO high-rise style buildings- only 2 stories! ~ Concierge Holland Carter is super helpful and awesome ~ Take or leave lending library bookshelf in lobby ~ On site mini-spa- very tiny and not very posh but therapists were great! ~ Ocean views look out to the islands Lanai and Molokai ~ Close proximity to Honolua General store, Gazebo restaurant (breakfast!!) Maui Brew-Co, Roys and a handful of small sandwich, taco or coffee shops. ~ Get the full experience of all the Kapalua resort features w/o staying there!- beautiful grounds, walking path, restaurants and shops. ~ Close proximity to other great beaches and snorkel locations: Kapalua Bay, Honolua Bay, Napili Point CONS: ~ Free snorkel (No fins) - These were not great quality and gave us trouble. After one day of using them we headed to Snorkel Bobs-close by and paid the $9/day for everything- well worth it. ~ I guess its a pro that they do have a restaurant (The Sea House) on site, but we did not care for it. The Pupus (appetizers) were less than stellar and the waitstaff was constantly trying to up-sell us on more drinks and food- both when dining casually AND more formally!! It was uncalled for. ~ Lobby computers are pay-only. I thought this was a little ridiculous given that it is a pretty nice resort, and everyone needs to use them eventually to print out boarding passes. And there is NO wireless access at the resort. We only had an ipod touch with us so this was a problem. There was in-room ethernet connection if you had a laptop. ~No chaise lounge chairs allowed on the beach-only pool. For the beach they have those little low-slung beach seats which are fine but not great. Also no cabanas to speak of. ~ Hotel staff is pretty quiet and reserved. They could do a better job of promoting the daily events in the lobby. Their main method of promotion is to leave messages on your in-room phone which is annoying. ~Can be WINDY!! All-in-all if you want to stay on the NW part of the island, and have a nice selection of amenities- this is probably your best bet. It is a great location for families, couples or seniors, and is clean despite the 80s revival going on in the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “What an Incredible Place”
Reviews.Author: StevenH_10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just completed a two-week stay at the Napili Kai Beach Resort. This was our third trip to Hawaii and our first to Maui. We have some experience with travel in this country and others, to include a number of stays at five-star resorts. This is the finest hotel/resort we have ever stayed in. To say that about a resort like this is somewhat out of character for us because we usually seek out new hotels and the Napili Kai is an older resort, at least by Maui standards - some buildings almost 50 years old. This resort has an incredible history that overcame many challenges in its early days to become the jewel that it is today. You have watched the 60's movies that have all the cool exotic places that no longer exist and you wish you could still experience them when they were new? This is it. You almost expect the Rat Pack to walk around the corner in one of the hallways. The Napili Kai resort is immaculately maintained down to the finest detail - both buildings and grounds. There is no faded paint - every inch of the place is freshly painted. If there is a leaf on the ground in the morning, someone will have removed it by that afternoon. The grass throughout the resort (watered every day) is like a manicured putting green without a weed in it. The beach and shoreline are gorgeous - has to be one of the best in Maui. Our room was in the Puna II building, which recently underwent a multi-million dollar renovation. This building is an upgrade, but for what they charge you, it is well worth it. Full kitchen, GE Profile appliances, granite countertops, real cherry cabinets, large lanai with heavy expensive whicker cushioned furniture - I could go on, but won't. We have stayed at Conrads and Ritz-Carltons - this room was the nicest we have ever stayed in. And speaking of the Lanai and hotel in general, when they built this place in the 60's and added on in the 70's, you could almost build on top of the ocean - they can't do that anymore. Our room was just a few feet from the ocean and we went to sleep every night with the sound of ocean breaking against the rocks below our room. And although our room was an upgrade, we looked at a number of other remodeled rooms (although not remodeled to the extent of our building) in other buildings that were nice. And I think almost every room in the place has a wonderful view of the ocean. The staff is incredible and many have worked there for decades (their name tags tell you how long they have been with Napili Kai). I think one of the bartenders has been there over 30 years. Staff will bend over backwards for you. As a whole, they are the nicest, most respectful and most helpful we have ever encountered. When we arrived to check in I approached the desk staff person and told her who I was. She did not say anything and walked away. She returned moments later with a papaya drink for me and said, "Welcome home." The resort advertises that it is family friendly and we found that to be the case. But what you will find here are mostly middle aged and older couples. It is a nice, quite place and if you like to let your kids run screaming through the hallways all day, then you won't be welcomed and this resort is not for you. The hotel's Beach House Restaurant has very good food and is very affordable for breakfast and lunch. Dinner at the restaurant is a more dress up affair (by Maui standards) and somewhat expensive (by my standards), but you get what you pay for and dinner is excellent. We like to explore our destinations and drove over 1,000 miles in our rental car. We found Lahaina (15 minutes from the Napili Kai) to be the most interesting and fun town on the island. Very touristy, but what isn't in Hawaii? What you will find is a beautifully picturesque town on the ocean with a lot of wonderful restaurants. The Beach Boys liked the town so much, they wrote a song about it. In reading the other reviews in TripAdvisor for the Napili Kai, I think our review is pretty consistent with other reviewers. There were a couple of reviewer comments, however, that our experience did not support. Some reviewers commented on bugs in the room. We saw very few bugs. This is a tropical climate. There are bugs in every hotel room in every hotel in Hawaii. Ask anyone who lives in this kind of climate. It is a battle you can fight, but will never win. Some complain about the regimented towel policy. You receive plastic cards that you turn in for beach towels at the beach house. You receive a towel for each card. When you turn the towel back in to the beach house, you receive your card back and when you check out they want their cards back. The resort is going to charge you for each plastic card you don't have at checkout. It is no big deal. The resort does this because if they didn't, no one would ever bring their towels back and the resort would be spending tons of money on towels. Many hotels don't even make beach towels available for you. My wife and I have stayed in many great places and at many great hotels, but have never had a desire to return to the same hotel again. We will return to Maui and the Napili Kai to again experience this beautiful island and classic resort.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANT, UNHURRIED JEWEL on MAUI”
Reviews.Author: IslandVisit0r
Reviews.Content: We booked a flight, car and hotel deal through Expedia after I searched the internet for a few days for value-for-money-deals-at-a-resort-type-of-choice..... and whilst expecting less,we got so much more ! Close-to-beachfront-feet-in-the-sand-stuff was our aim at a resort which we thought would be more of the beaten track, yet within a short drive from everything...and we were so pleased ! We've stayed at them alll: many a five and four star resort on a few continents and then got less than expected. This time round we rather went with a value deal at a nice resort in Maui,and the holiday turned out really,really good and relaxing for us ! If you are looking for a yuppie 5 star resort where you have to be entertained every minute of the day or have to be in the main stream where everything happens there and then first.....well this is not for you. What you will find here however is a VERY beautiful covy,tropical beach, good for swimming (but take care,don't be a Mr Olympic), snorkeling (which I did for the very first time and will do going forward), and rock exploring on low tide (no kilometer on kilometer on kilometer walking though but a nice longish walk from side to side none the less), BEAUTIFUL big and well maintained gardens (which sets the scene), adequate sized,neat and equipped rooms, putting greens with 18 plus holes (beautifully groomed), a beach restaurant on the rocks, an adequate exercise room and other nice and thoughtful stuff. As for some comments about the "towels issue" and the resort not being for young children, well....I beg to differ...no problem on our side at all with in-house-rules or issues with our child during our stay ! You can walk (really!) one block and be on the golf course and have to drive 10 minutes to Safeway for main grocery shopping at Lahaina(here again, no need for the bigger grocery shopping when you've just landed...do that the next day after you've rested, at Safeway ! (We found the prices really reasonable). Lots of other dining options all over and quick eat locations close as well. Tips: take basic insurance on car - some roads are tight and parking generally is tight everywhere ! do the Haleakala (?) Crater trip by car - takes 6 or 7 hours but the views from that crater of Maui and surrounds on a clear day can't be described in words. watch the traditional Hawaiian Lahau (?) In Lahaina if you don't know whether you'll have the chance to visit Hawaii again. drink pina cooladas ....these islanders REALLY know how to make them. do some snorkeling and explore a whole new world ! This hotel is real value for money! Dedicated staff everywhere compliments this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: binkysmom
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at Napili Kai in the last three years & it is just wonderful. An 'oceanview' Lani suite has a spectacular view of the gorgeous bay. The rooms, the beach, & the grounds are immaculate. It is NOT hard to follow the rules on towels. This time, we saw whales from our lanai three different times. The concierge is excellent & the staff are all unfailingly polite & friendly. We will back again . . . I almost hesitate to tell people because I don't want to give out our secret :-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, perfect, perfect”
Reviews.Author: kavnsandiego
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times and are getting ready for another trip later this year. The location is great! I am not a strong swimmer, but the beach here is perfect for swimming, snorkeling and lounging. I love the putt-putt course and mai tai party. The rooms are updated, clean and nice. The kitchen is functional and all you really need for vacation. This place is excellent and the bloody mary's are delicious.

Reviews.Title: “More Meaningless Rules Than A Retirement Village In Florida”
Reviews.Author: Coltraveller
Reviews.Content: This resort has more arbitrary rules than an retirement village in Boca Raton. Here are a few examples: 1. When you check in, they give you a few plastic cards that you can exchange for beach towels. In theory, you are supposed to get the cards back when you return your beach towels. If you don't return the exact number of cards that you were given at check in, you are charged some outrageous sum per towel when you check out. Don't get me wrong, I am all in favor of conserving resources. In reality, however, some guests lose their towels and steal someone else's towel to avoid the fine. In the five days that we were there, we had our towels stolen twice. When we told the guy at the beach hut what happened, he told us: "you are supposed to stay with your towels." I guess they expect you to wear the towels on your head like turbins when you go swimming. Anyway, who wants spend their vacation closely guarding a worn out beach towel? 2. The resort claims that kids eat free. But, if your child makes that mistake of ordering a "short stack" of 2 pancakes instead of a regular stack of 3 pancakes, they will charge you because the term "short stack" is used on the adult menu and includes a few nuts, while the "stack" of 3 pancakes is listed on the children's menu. 3. Although they advertise that all snorkeling equipment is free, this is misleading. It doesn't include fins. (We were told that, if we wanted fins, we could rent some at Snorkel Bobs.) In addition, during the first two days of our trip, we couldn't swim at the resort because of strong rip currents. Although there were other beaches nearby that were safe for swimming, the guy in the beach hut told us that they didn't like the snorkel equipment to leave the property and that it had to be returned each day by 5pm. When we finally got a mask and snorkel on our third day, the equipment was uncleaned and full of sand. 4. Although they advertise that the condos include daily maid service, there are signs in the condo stating that the maids have been instructed not to clean the kitchen (not even a glass or coffee mug) for some unexplicable reason. Finally, don't believe the Napili Kai's marketing statements and reviewers like Frommer's who claim that the Napili Kai is a real "find" for travelers with kids. When you enter the room, you will see literature stating something to the effect that children are expected to be under control at all times because "many of [their] guests have passed their child rearing years and/or chosen to go on vacation without their children." I believe that it is self-evident that parents should monitor their children, and such statements are patronizing. There is a strictly enforced quiet time between 10 pm and 8 am because the walls in the condos are thin. Ironically, although children are expected to be seen and not heard, you will hear lawn equipment and Fox TV blaring from some condos at odd hours. The claim that there are washers/dryers in all units is false: there are coin operated laundry machines in a few buildings. These all close at 8 pm. Although they advertise that they have a Keiki Club during "Spring Break/Easter" and I was told that they would have this when I booked my reservation two months in advance, I was told at check in that they had decided not to do the Keiki Club that week, but that children could attend the 1/2 hour presentations on lei making, etc. There was no one under 60 at those presentations. The bottom line: If the resort wants to cater to older guests, that's fine. But, they shouldn't market themselves as being "kid friendly."

Reviews.Title: “This is what the islands are all about.”
Reviews.Author: KamalaniCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband's family has been guests at Napili Kai Beach Resort since it was Napili Kai Beach Club. I fell in love 10 years ago when my fiance brought me here to be married on the grounds of the Resort. It is the one place, in our many travels, that I need to return to over and over again. It is home, it is family, it is everything paradise should be. It is not fancy, it is Hawaiian. Stunning grounds, gracious staff that is there year after year and to say it is relaxing is an understatement. This is the only place I have ever left to return home and cried. I cry because it is so special and it will be another year before I can see and feel it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family place on the best beach - just make sure its what you want”
Reviews.Author: runningpie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Napili Kai with our 5 year old for 6 days in Dec 09. We LOVED it. At the same time the negative reviews you see here all have a grain of truth, so just make sure Napili is what you want. Read a dozen or so reviews and you'll get the idea. It's an old-timey Maui resort that feels like it must have been here 30 years ago before the condomania. It shares one of the best beaches on the whole island with several other small resorts (hence the odd towel policy which is NO big deal.) Its all open air with nice sized rooms - all with very serviceable kitchens and every thing you need to prepare simple meals. Almost every room has a great view - even the cheap ones. The area is one of the nicest spots on the whole island - just ask the people across the street at the Ritz Carlton. The best golf course on the island - Kapalua ( home of the PGA event) is also across the street. We LOVED our room. One tip - beg borrow and steal to get on the second floor. The single biggest drawback of the place (if you choose to see it that way) is that everyone has their windows open to take advantage of the wonderful breeze, so you can hear and see more than what you would normally at a mega-resort. We loved it. As you can see from the reviews, some people don't. They ought to cross the street and stay at the Ritz. In comparison the Napili Kai is an extremely homey and fun place with wonderful help. Just super relaxing. We loved it. FYI I would call the restaurant overrated although you can't beat the view. Food in general in Maul is crazy expensive. Use your kitchen. The beach to the North (?) of the hotel has a little more surf and better snorkeling ( just walk to it across the parking lot.) There is an excellent high-end restaurant over there also - it all sits in front of the Ritz. There is a LONG ocean-front trail for you joggers. And the drive around the point is well worth it. Loved the laua in old town Lahaina. Buy book "Maui Revealed" for excellent travel tips. If you're adventurous all those drives (Hana etc.) are great fun. No need for 4WD (follow the book!). Great deals on the web. I might not be so happy if I paid full-price.

Reviews.Title: “NOT MY CUP OF TEA”
Reviews.Author: marinemother
Reviews.Content: I am always amazed when I read reviews that rave about a hotel/resort that I have stayed at and found to be a dump! I wonder how my taste and expectations could be so different from some of the reviewers on Tripadvisor. I was familiar with the resort from having dined at their restaurant many times, so I decided to stay there for a few nights. The reviews and the photos of the rooms looked quite nice. But, you really can't always trust or believe what you read. Our room had a wonderful view, no doubt. But the room itself was like a cheap motel room, every aspect of it was dingy. The bed is not uncomfortable but it is your standard cheap bed with no pillow top, The shower, towels, furniture, kitchen items we cheap and dingy, the same as you would find in an old motel. As others have stated, there is no air conditioning, which isn't such a big deal at night, but during the day, it does make a difference because the humidity can be high in Maui. There is no elevator, so you schlep your bags up and down stairs, the carpets are old, worn and dirty. There are more "rules" than I am comfortable with having when I am staying at a resort, you have to give a key to get a towel, you have to bring the towel back or be charged $20, and that's just the beginning of the rules. In this economy, you can find a nicer place to stay at similar or better rates. However, this is a resort that obviously can please people, but it definitely is not for me. It does not add up, I didn't find it comfortable or cheery to be in and if you go to the Hawaiian Islands, there are better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Great, Rooms need to be updated”
Reviews.Author: Temp94611
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Napili Kai many times. The location is great. Good Snorkeling and Boggie Boarding. However, the rooms are really dated compared to Napili Point hotel. Particularly for the price which is relatively high. We loved going over to Kapalua bay and had great dinner at Merrimans-expensive but worth it The kids also liked the minigolf a lot. One of the main reasons we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pass this one up!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTvlAgent
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another fantastic stay in Maui. This time at the Napili Kai. The grounds and location can not be beat. The staff is friendly, welcoming. The hotel has such a great story of their almost 50 years there. The buildings are low rise, Hawaiian style... they decor has be upgraded. Putting parties, juices and coffee brought to beachside cabana everyday, gas BBQ's to use with a view of the ocean, free parking, no resort fee, on fantastic beach, No need for paying $100 a day special lounge chair, or high rise building to walk from.... this place is worth your business. (this "free" advise comes from someone in the business, who loves Hawaii. Dont waste your vacation money by misleading ads online... ask a local travel agent who has been there!)

Reviews.Title: “heaven”
Reviews.Author: Mat-Sl
Reviews.Content: Very quiet place, awesome views, great beach, nice rooms. Free High-speed internet in your room. Fitness room (free). Hot tube, swimming pools, and more... I highly recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Napili Kai is a nice, quiet place, fun too.”
Reviews.Author: Also_Intrepid
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nghts in October 2009. We had a 2nd floor room with no AC. That's a problem for part of the evening. Our room was like a little efficiency apartment. We had a refrigerator and a small cooking area with burners and a microwave. The lawn sprinklers worked very well, they came on at 1 AM every night without fail. The beach is in a little cove and faces SW, great for sunsets. This beach is a little narrow, but with plenty of space for everyone. However, shade is in short supply, just a few palms around. Go to the KMart and buy a little umbrella; that will make your beach stay so much nicer. The restaurant here seems to cater to non-residents, but was good enough. Withing walking distance are two great restaurants, one next door serving locovore food, and the Pineapple Grill one block away (uphill). This was a good place to be which is not a megaresort. There are plenty of activities during the day to interest those with the time, and quiet at night for resting. As usual, charging a fee for every extra amenity is tiresome, but we didn't use any.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE”
Reviews.Author: redmond2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights at the Westin Maui and then 5 nights at the Napili Kai. The Westin was a hassle from the start and we needed to be pushy just to get changed into a decent room. The Napili Kai, on the other hand, was lovely and relaxing from the start. The rooms are not luxurious but are VERY nice. The grounds are beautiful and the beach is perfect. We did have a few small ants and a pesty small cockroach in the kitchen but this was very acceptable considering all the positives. There is a very nice grocery store right in Napili and the resort even has a nice offer so that you can order a meal to prepare on your own for a very reasonable price. They have a book in the room which gives the history of the resort which made me feel that ,at least originally, this was a place with a heart for the traveler and for the Hawaiian community.

Reviews.Title: “awesome!”
Reviews.Author: era33
Reviews.Content: stayed for 5 nights in a beach front room. View was terrific. Paid for a ocean view room but was upgraded to a beach from room without even asking. The room was great. Loved cooking breakfast/lunch. Room was clean and quiet. The kitchen had most of the essentials one would need to prepare a meal. Also enjoyed the Mai Tai free happy hour and the daily tea party.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii 5-0”
Reviews.Author: BiliH
Reviews.Content: Beautiful views from the expansive balcony including the whales blowing by. Don't miss the snorkeling in the bay or a catamarran trip over to Lanai. Thai food close by to the sounds of folk surfer music drifting over the beach. A great birthday trip with plenty of scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in one resort”
Reviews.Author: atreyu797
Reviews.Content: Excellent food! We ate at the restaurant 3 of the five nights and they havea great bar. We were there for our honeymoon, and will be back again and again especially when we have kids

Reviews.Title: “Wow! We must be in the wrong room!”
Reviews.Author: Humulus51
Reviews.Content: We totally agree with all the 5 star reviews. Forget the Kaanapali high rises on a skinny stretch of congested beach. Yep, they have stunning lobbies, lots of fun shops and restaurants within walking distance, but for sheer relaxation, try Napili Kai Beach Resort. We booked an Ocean View Studio via Expedia. We didn't expect the incredible view from room 77 in the Aloha building. My wife actually said "Did they give us the wrong room?" Wow indeed. The grounds are impeccable, with grills and picnic tables stashed away in several areas. Small swimming pools scattered throughout the resort, a large Jacuzzi tucked in a garden area. The low rise buildings blend into the grounds. The resort never felt crowded, and is definitely not suited for those seeking loud nightlife. The Sea House restaurant was fantastic. Not the cheapest Maui restaurant, download their menu from napilikai.com, but a great value for creative cuisine, and it compares quite well with the nicer places on the island for imagination and quality The Whale Watchers bar at the Sea House has one of the coolest bar views ever. Don't miss enjoying a couple of breakfasts and lunches at the Sea House as well. Absolutely the best island pancakes on Maui. Don't believe the hype surrounding the place on the other end of the beach. Napili Bay beach never has crashing waves, unless the weather is crazy. It's well protected, and great for lazy snorkeling, floating and just hanging out. Super clear water, even when it's 20 feet deep, you feel as if your feet are just skimming the bottom! The room was perfect for two people. A galley kitchen with full sized fridge, glass cooktop, and a convection microwave. My only complaint was that the cocktail glasses were too small for making ginormous Gin and Tonics. Oh, my....such a pain to have to walk all the way from the lanai to the kitchen for a refill. Perhaps the Napili Kai deserves just a one star review for such a travesty? Our room did not have A/C, and even if it had, we wouldn't have needed it or used it. The ceiling fan provided any additional air movement we needed when the trade winds weren't gently blowing. Closing the windows and doors would have been unthinkable. Even with the daily temps in the upper 80's, every evening was perfect for sleeping. We are already planning to visit NKBR again...and I almost hesitated to provide a review, not wanting to share this gem. I could ramble on forever. Drop me a line if you have any more specific questions.

Reviews.Title: “Number One Resort in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Barbara026
Reviews.Content: Napili Kai Beach Resort just gets better every visit. Wonderful accomodations, excellent food, greatest scenery, beach and snorkeling, friendly people, always consistent service. Great walking, it's no wonder that people return to Napili Kai Beach Resort year after year.

Reviews.Title: “Napili Kai captures the spirit of Aloha”
Reviews.Author: musical_sailor
Reviews.Content: As part of a multi island trip we stayed in an Ocean View Studio (Lani 2) in Napili Kai for 5 nights. The family consensus was that this was our favorite hotel of the trip. The attitude of everyone on the staff we met was terrific and we appreciated the philosophy of the resort of not trying to charge for every little extra. The grounds are nicely landscaped. The beach was terrific and for those travelling with children you might find yourself having a hard time getting them away to explore the rest of the island. The beach has a nice reef that starts around 100-150 feet away from shore and features an abundance of fish and invertabrates. If you want to see the humuhumunukunukuapua'a (state fish) look no further. Try and get out earlier in the day or when winds and waves are minimal for best visibility. Our studio in Lani 2 did not have air conditioning and we found that sleeping with the windows open and screens door shut was very comfortable. If we had AC we would have chosen not to use it. The studio had been recently refurbished including new kitchen and bathroom both of which had granite counters and tile and nice appliances. The kitchen was well stocked with basics and we appreciated being able to have breakfast and a meal or two in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: SeattleCatt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Napili Kai with my husband for our first trip to hawaii and our honeymoon. I loved the location! It was wonderful, we had a studio on the beach. It was great falling asleep to the sound of the ocean and waking up and walking out to the beach right in front of our porch. My family stayed down in Wailea their hotel was a beautiful resort but I was so happy we got to be right on the beach it was a totally diffrent feel from what they had.

Reviews.Title: “increadibly beautiful property, very relaxing and affordable”
Reviews.Author: PasadenaFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: On this vacation trip my wife and I traveled with our two young children (boy and girl, 5 and 3). Suite that we stayed was clean, spacious, nicely decorated with an amazing views to the Napili bay and a beach that is great for everybody specially kids, the room that we stayed had all the amenities, CD player (for music and movies), flat screen TV, etc etc. If you have kids same age than ours this is the place to stay. This coming from somebody that usually stays at the four seasons. We absolutely enjoyed each day of our stay and highly recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: npdj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in April 09. Having never been to Maui....boy did we get lucky! We chose Napili Kai randomly off of hotels.com and it was the best choice we could have made. The staff are warm and friendly. They seem more like a family and in fact we learned that several generations of some familys work there. The grounds are beautiful and kept impeccably. There are 3 pools and a hot tub. The pools are quite small. The beachfront is sandy and great for sunbathing or for children to play. Its in a bay that is great for snorkeling. You can check out towels, coolers, and various other items for free. Juice and fruit are served in a beach cabana at 11am every day. There are various free activities every day. i.e lei making. I loved our room. There was no air cond. but we didn't mind. There were great big tropical ceiling fans that kept us perfectly cool. Our room was only considered ocean view but it was only about 30 ft from the beach. We could sit on the lanai and see Launi and Molokai. The on site restuarant, The Sea House, is fabuluos! They serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner. We ate at several different places on Maui but we ate the most at The Sea House because the food and staff are so great. Also it is RIGHT on the beach with the best view of the Maui sunset and we also spotted whales right from the deck. We are definitely going back next year and taking the kids with us.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, amazing ocean views, definitely felt relaxed!”
Reviews.Author: mauiisthebest1
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Hawaii. We were supposed to have a destination wedding in Mexico, but that was cancelled due to the swine flu situation. My fiance and I decided to go to Maui and tie the knot there. From the moment we stepped into Napili Kai, we knew we made the right decision to come to Maui. It was more gorgeous, tropical, and relaxing than I had anticipated. We had our wedding the 2nd day there. Everything went smoothly. There were so many places on napili bay to get wedding shots. It is usually busy around sunset, but for some reason we lucked out and there weren't very many people on the beach. We had dinner under the stars (hosted by Seahouse Restaurant) and it was AMAZING. The BEST dinner I have ever had, excellent service, and we even got married at the site where the dinner was held. The wedding couldn't have been more perfect. The complex is in a very good location. We enjoyed barbequing at night by the ocean and spending time in the Hankipanki Wirlpool. Napili Bay has excellent snorkelling. Some days the waves are really big, and some days it is calm. My husband bought a skimboard, as Napili Bay is on a slope. We also liked how you get beach chairs, towels, and a cooler. We signed out the cooler at the beginning of the trip and used it the whole time we were there. We also enjoyed the mini golf and mai tai party. The room was very comfortable, amazing views of the ocean. My only complaint would be the birds chirping at 5:30 a.m. every morning, but I was already up at that time anyways. There isn't much transportation from Napili to Lahaina. An hour bus ride or pretty expensive taxis, but we had such a good time driving in the rental car. We were able to explore and stop at the beaches along the highway. All in all I would have to say this was our best trip ever! We already want to go back and we have only been home for 1 week. Hope this helps you in your decision!

Reviews.Title: “no airconditioning”
Reviews.Author: drl55
Reviews.Content: Very nice people and beach. Our room was not equipted with any a/c. It wasn't broken just not there. Too muggy. Glad we only stayed one night. Dogs on beach and just sand chairs that don't recline on the beach. The pool had lounge chairs. "Free" snorkel equiptment did not include fins or any sort of live preserver. Quite a hike to the parking lot as well. No elevators. Glad we were on the first floor with all that luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Slice of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: tatmanb
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 day stay at the Napili Kai and we had a great time. We have a 3 year old and really enjoyed the pools and the calm bay. Our unit was 50 steps from the beach and very well appointed. Overall, I would say this is a great place for families. The free snorkel gear, rafts& boogie boards were an added bonus. The grounds were imaculate and the putting course was great for Dad. Staff was excellent as well! Make sure you ask for a room with Air Conditioning if its going to be hot.

Reviews.Title: “Remember the Place is nearly 50 years old!”
Reviews.Author: mistermaui
Reviews.Content: A lot of reviews have identified the key features of Napili Kai- homey, gorgeous location, not-so-great restaurant, bugs, nice grounds, some dated rooms, no A/C in some units. The spa isn't a spa, the tennis court long gone, and it's either family time or geriatric, depending on when you visit. What people seem to miss, is the genuine, authentic ohana ambience. It has a real charm, unfound in most other places in Hawaii. The staff are loyal and long serving. There is no corporate ownership- just a bunch of shareholders who are basically trying to have a familiar comfy place to go every winter. They pour pretty much all the money earned into property maintenance and redecorating. No fancy dividends for the owners, for sure! It was built in 1960, wood frame, so that helps explain some of the deficiencies. Compare to Kapalua Bay Hotel, built ca 1982?, already torn down. Also- like the Sheraton at Black Rock, Kaanapali, being first on the block gets you pride of place. The prevailing winds are north east, so the whole property is beautifully protected by the point of land separating it from Kapalua. I recommend the Lani rooms, or Keaka for bigger units. Puna has a rocky foreshore, and is genuinely dated- though they are embarking on an upgrade to that wing now (2009). You can stay at any of the other condos on Napili Beach for a lot less than NKBR. But you are getting a quasi beach resort, not just a condo- with towel service, mini-golf, mai t'ai parties, daily maid service, restaurant and bar. So- nothing like the fancy 5 star hotels, and better than most condos. You either love it or not!

Reviews.Title: “Love Napili Kai!”
Reviews.Author: wakinghours
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the second time -- once for a honeymoon about 5 years ago, and this time with our toddler for 7 nights. Very helpful staff, beautiful grounds, excellent beach, decent rooms. From the reviews I've read here, people that are looking for the modern, upscale Resort experience may not care much for Napili Kai, but if you're looking for a classic, old school, resort experience - Napili Kai is probably for you. One of the best things about Napili Kai is it's location - Napili Bay is protected against over development -- No building can be taller than the trees, so you won't see much in the way of modern development here. It's sort of a time capsule for a simpler, quieter time. The beach is really nice for swimming, occasionally some bigger waves but using the beach is very calm, and for the most part, sandy, particularly in the middle area. If it's snorkeling you want, a quick walk through the parking lot takes you to Kapalua Beach. There seemed to be a nice mix of retirees, families and young couples - but overall, it's a really peaceful, quiet place for the most part. We stayed in the Puna II building, set back from the beach - very secluded and quiet, with an excellent lanai, and remodeled kitchen, but no AC. Did notice a few of the "invisible ants" people wrote about in the reviews, but not a big problem. Also spent a few nights in the Honolua building, which is right by the beach and the main pool. Still a great view, and AC (which IS nice to have on the hotter days). Kitchen much smaller and not remodeled, but still decent enough to cook lunches and small dinners. In room Hi Speed internet access via Ethernet cable was great - wireless worked very well in the Puna II room, not so good in the Honolua building. Someone mentioned in a review that the showerheads weren't adequate to get sand off from the beach, but we had no problem with the showerheads either of us had in our rooms. Really loved breakfasts at the Sea House restaraunt, and having drinks at the bar. You can't get any closer to the beach! Overall it was a great experience and we can't wait to get back to Napili Kai for a third visit!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Nic2345
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the first four nights of our trip to Maui, and we loved the hotel. In fact, we liked it a lot better than the "fancy" place we stayed at later in our trip in Wailea. What I liked most about the property is the fact that the buildings are all only two stories high, and the general shape of the buildings blends in nicely with the coastline. It's not one of those giant hunks of concrete stuck on a beach, which is what you get with a lot of the other hotels in Maui. I was a little nervous when I found out we were on the ground floor, as one of the previous reviewers mentioned a lack of privacy, but I think it really depends on your building. We had an ocean view studio in the Lani 2 building, and our room was completely private, tucked away behind some bushes and a grassy area where nobody walked. The room itself was very pretty, with a very comfortable bed, nice bathroom, and big, beautiful lanai looking out on the water. The kitchenette was well stocked with everything you'd need to cook meals. We were nice and cool at night with the ceiling fan and screen doors. The beach itself was a little crowded for my taste, but everybody was so happy that you couldn't help but be swept up in it, and I ended up not minding at all. The water was clear and flat while we were there, and the calm water made it a great place to bring kids (and lots of people did). We were able to do some great snorkeling, and we saw several sea turtles! If there's one negative I can think of, it's that the hotel doesn't rent umbrellas, and there's no shade on the beach in the afternoon -- and the sun is very strong. They had a couple of flimsy umbrellas that had been left by other guests, but they weren't great, and there weren't enough of them. But we managed to find some shade up on the lawn under some trees, so it wasn't too bad if you didn't mind chasing the shadows around with your chair. So if you are on the pale side like me, bring your own umbrella! It will probably be worth the money if you're traveling around to different beaches on the island anyway. We ate at the restaurant one night and thought the food was pretty good. We returned a few times to the bar for their excellent Mai Tais! We also loved the little pathway going along the rocks next to the hotel. All in all, I would most definitely recommend this hotel to anybody looking for somewhere beautiful and tranquil in West Maui. I can't wait to go back some day!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations all around”
Reviews.Author: islaisla
Reviews.Content: The place was exactly as advertised - very quiet, great beach, friendly/helpful staff, incredible sea views, world class garden, super clean, etc. Puna Point & Puna II rooms still to be updated but still as good as most 4 star hotels. Other updated rooms are excellent. Overall you couldn't ask for a better spot to relax and enjoy beach life.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: msz_stina
Reviews.Content: For someone traveling in their early 20's was great! I woke up to a beautiful sunrise and fell asleep to a spectacular sunset. Rooms are big enough for 1-2 people. The beach is okay, I went there when it was windy, but I got a good tan! Food was delicious and cheap and the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Best trip to Maui yet!”
Reviews.Author: cap461
Reviews.Content: We had traveled up from Kaanapalli on our last trip to Maui and wanted to get away from the high rises on this trip and boy did we make the right decision. In Napili, no building can be taller than the palm trees. We came to Napili Kai mostly because when we were here on the last trip and saw how well it blended into its surrounding enviroment and its proximity to great snorkeling beaches. We hoped it would live up to our expectations, well it not only lived up to our expectations by the accomodations, the friendly staff, other guests and the grounds, it surpassed it. We came to spend our 30th wedding anniversary in paradise and to relax and snorkel. We are fairly low keyed people and the Napili Kai was the perfect pick for us. When we booked with Cheap Hawaii Tickets we were not sure what condo we would get but asked for a ocean front and second floor and would highly recommend that for anyone. We were lucky and got a preferred condo in the Puna II building (room 221). The view when we walked in and opened the lanai doors just blew us away, ocean everywhere and could be seen from just about anywhere in the room. We spent many hours on the lanai watching whales, turtles and people, great fun. The Puna buildings are out on the rocky point and more quiet than the beach front units which worked out fine for us, no beach, but a short walk on the path gets you to the beach. I have read where some have complained about the accomodations being dated and the ghost ants. The Puna rooms are to be updated this summer but seemed fine for us (we live in house over 100ys. old). The ghost ants were not an issue because we kept everything in the fridge or oven, plus they don't eat much anyway. The snorkeling in Napili Bay is very good and we saw turtles many times and Kapalua Bay is just a short across the parking lot and the snorkeling is also great there. Check out Honolua Store in Kapalua and Maui Tacos in Napili for good inexpensive eating options. We had a great time and hope to return to Napili Kai Beach Resort as soon as we can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: maurwine
Reviews.Content: My second holiday to Napili Kai and can honestly say it just gets better and better. The gals/guys who work there couldn't give more, the accommodation wqas superb and the whole ambience is/was FANTASTIC. Many thanks to Maui and mainly to Napili Kai for making my 60th the bestest ever. xxx

Reviews.Title: “I love the Napili Kai.”
Reviews.Author: NewYorker44
Reviews.Content: I love the Napili Kai. My family started going there over 30 years ago when my mother was a travel consultant with an agency that specialized in Hawaii. Since then, although everything around the hotel has changed dramatically (and horribly in many cases), the Napili Kai has remained virtually the same (not in a bad way). It isn't quite as family-run as it used to be, but when you arrive there is still a warm and friendly feeling--they offer you fruit juice (and they are also very happy to help you get your luggage to your room, in case you are worried about climbing the stairs). What I love most about the Napili Kai is its location: it's one of the few places on Maui (or on many of the islands) where highrises, speedboats, etc., are not permitted. (In fact the hotel's original management was also responsible for pushing for the anti-development laws that have kept the bay frozen in time.) So, if you really want a real beach vacation--i.e., sunbathing, reading books, swimming, etc.--it is perfect. But if you want night life, sensation, and easy access to other activities, it may not be the best for you. Since all I want from a Hawaiian vacation is relaxation and a little daily exercise, it is just right for me. There are other hotels along the beach, but the Napili Kai was there first and has the best situation. The bay has gentle tides and is perfectly sized for swimming laps (I think that 4 times back and forth roughly equals a mile of open water). The water is almost always beautifully clear at this end and offers plenty of interesting fish and coral reef to examine. The other reason I love the Napili Kai is that it has the feeling of an old beach club. Every time I go, I meet people who have been coming back there for years (just like my family). This year we went at Xmas, something we've always wanted to do, and the hotel was filled with big family groups and tons of kids. It was really fun to watch their antics every day. At other times, the hotel has seemed quieter and more romantic. Once we saw a couple getting married on the rocks, just a few yards from our room. Everyone on the beach broke into applause. I can't imagine this happening at a big high-rise hotel. I also think it would be a great place for a honeymoon. Re: amenities: the restaurant has never been all that great--in the past you just had to give in and accept that it was going to be kind of hokey. But on this trip, it seemed greatly improved and we really enjoyed the two dinners and one lunch we had there (order the papaya with crab salad). There is now a Costco by the airport and a local farmer's market where you can get fruit and vegetables quite cheaply. Snorkel equipment and fresh towels are available at the snack bar and I got fins from Snorkel Bob's for $8 for the week. Units can be variable, but this time we had a great one, with newly renovated kitchen and bathrooms. Everything was spotless and well-stocked and the staff is very friendly. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: BrightonBill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napili Kai for a week (Oct 8 - 15) in a ground floor beachfront studio. The room was wonderful, bed comfy and the maid kept it very tidy. Yes there were a few ants but a quick spray by maintenance and we never saw them the rest of the week. The kitchen came in handy for the few meals we cooked while there and the grills on the grounds worked great. We stayed in room 5. Upon checking in the lady in room 6 (Sandy) popped over and invited us to the building's nightly get together in the pavilion by the beach. We accepted and enjoyed everyone's company each evening as the sun set (I am attaching a picture of one of the best sunsets). We attended the Wednesday night slack key concert and it was really great. Each day there is a different activity like lei making or putt putt golf (with 50 cent drinks!) or the managers Mai Tai night. All in all this was a wonderful place to spend a week. The snorkeling in the bay was good, lots of fish and turtles and generally pretty calm. This may not make a very good base if you plan on doing a lot of venturing out. It is an hour from the OGG airport but the drive is nice. We did go to the Iao needle, Makena beach and the road to Hana as far as the Maui Grown Market (between mile marker 14 and 15). I am attaching a couple of pictures of that. It is the last stop before the long drive to Hana that you can get a picnic lunch put together and they make great sandwiches. You can also get a dog to ride along with you if you miss yours back home! We will stay at the Napili Kai on any future visits to Maui and highly recommend it to anyone going.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Be prepared and you'll have fun!”
Reviews.Author: JayFromToronto
Reviews.Content: PRO: - beautiful landscaping - secluded area - quiet, get away from the usually rowdy crowds at hotels - think Cuba type resorts, but not all inclusive - Napili Bay is good for snorkling, and generally nice - not Grand Waliea style, so great for relaxing - friendly staff, and warm surroundings (unlike larger multilevel hotels) - kitchenette, fully stocked utensils, etc... More on that later - putting greens - gas grills, CLEAN! - whirlpool open late CONS: - not Grand Waliea style, so don't expect spic-and-span cleanliness - far away from Hana, though if you book Alec the Jungle Guy, it makes up for it - ghost ants. More on that later - kitchenette, fully stocked utensils, etc... More on that later - no AC in rooms... but it's usually good with the ceiling fans NOTES: So you see some double ups in the sections, I'll address those shortly. First again, this is a great place to relax. No need to rush for poolside chairs, etc like bigger places. This really is a nice resort. Ok. Ghost ants. I read about them in the last few reviews and it's true. I came prepared though. I bought a box (four-pack) of ant traps for $4 and brought them along. There is a Walmart in Maui so no biggie if forgotten. The rooms was very nice. Oceanview, room #82. The FIRST thing I did was scour for bedbugs... there were none. Great. Next, I looked for the ghost ants. Having only seen pictures on the net, I had no idea they were so tiny! Anyway, they were on the round table where they put the nice fresh plant. They were on the kitchen counter, and the odd one on the fridge and coffee maker. This turned me off from prepping any food for using the grills outside. Too bad. I would have so used the grills... There were NO ants on the vanity area where you would put your toothbrushes etc. That's great. Ok. Here I have to say, my wife is not squeamish about the ants. I showed her and she just shrugged them off as nothing. She doesn't like spiders though. Anyway. Even for me, if they were normal sized ants, I would have immediately vacated the room. These are just little... ghosts. First thing I did then is unpack the traps. Put one on the kitchenette area countertop. One on the round table, then I put a fresh FLOWER on top of it. This is key. The ants will go over the trap to the flower, and some will go in the trap. Works great. Next, move the plant they give you someplace else... like outside. Finally, place traps from the space between the wall and the dresser leg, so if they go near the legs up the dresser, they make a stop at the "ant hotel". First two days, they were busy. After that, There was only the odd few left. Key thing. Keep all food in the fridge, or zipped up on the dresser. Do not leave anything on the floor you don't want to take home with you. Though I don't see it as a problem, I don't need tropical bugs hiding in the bags and such if I leave them on the floor. This is a key to going anyplace anyway, so this is no different. Ok with that out of the way, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. As long as you are prepared, nothing is a big deal. If you come in to this fresh, then I can see you'd be surprised that this is no Ritz-Carlton :) Rustic, scenic, nice. Thing of a cottage. The bay is beautiful. They really keep the grounds clean and upkept. Family loved it that I can wave to them as they watch on the webcam from the Napili Kai website. By the way, the webcam quality is terrible, don't let that dissuade you. Expedia Local Expert on-site. Used them a few times. The resident cat(s) are pretty nice to play with too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Resort”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy_S_1973
Reviews.Content: We ended our Hawaiian vacation on Maui and chose the Napili Kai Resort on a friend's recommendation. The Good: The location is amazing. Napili Bay is paradise and the low rise buildings were a welcome relief after Waikiki and driving past Kaanapali. The grounds are also great and the hotel is generally very quiet. Our room was out in what they call Puna so it was even quieter. The restaurant was also really good although the service was a little "relaxed" at times, but my impatience could be my California sense of rush about everything. The Bad: There isn't much bad, but parts of the resort looked a little tired and in need of a face lift. Overall we were really pleased and plan to come back with the kids next summer.

Reviews.Title: “The pros and cons of Napili Kai”
Reviews.Author: reviewtohelp
Reviews.Content: I have been to Maui several times and have stayed next door to the Napii Kai and always wanted to try this hotel. I will list the pros and cons. We stayed 6 nights the beginning of August. Pros 1. The beach is beautiful and great for kids. 2. Kapula bay next door is also a great beach. Great for snorkeling. 3. When staying here the best rooms to book are the beachfront rooms for access directly to the beach on the bottom floor 4. Laundry facilities in each resort building unit. There is no wait (free soap but need quarters). You can easily wash clothes at night. 5. Mai Tai party (great mai tai's and even soda for kids and wine for those who do not want mai tai's. Great way to meet guest 6. Minature golf 7. Grills. They are placed around the resort and never a wait. There is one next to where the mai tai party is and is just beautiful at night to have dinner sitting outside above the bay. If renting a hotel room bring utensils for the grill. 8. The Sea House Restaurant - we enjoyed this restaurant for breakfast and dinner one night. The view is beautiful. I wish there were more choices when arriving late for something light since the snack bar is limited. We arrived around 3:30 and after unpacking went to get something to eat. We did not want a full dinner but there were not many choices except for salad. 9. Coolers are free to use at the snack stand along with snorkel masks (but should be told since I didn't know until I saw them) 10. Small store around the corner if no car 11. The refrigerator is a good size 12. The size of the bathroom is large is great for a family. 13. Very safe environment for children 14. Large closet space 15. Kids Hawaiian show 16. Internet access at the front desk lobby (I forget the cost. I think $2.00 for 5 minutes) Cons 1. The free coffee in the rooms and in the lobby is terrible. 2. For some reasons this area of Maui gets a lot of bugs. Swarms of bugs in the air during certain times was a bit annoying. I got a spider bite the first day and my leg swelled up. 3. The kids program is not run that well. We stayed here first on our trip and then moved to Kaanapali to be able to utilize the program but we could not get in 2 of days there because they only accept 8 children. When my son did get in, it was for pool games. The pool games were throw a ball in the pool and let the few kids in there use it. The counselor did not get the kids involved to play with each other. Very weak kids program. 4. Not clear on where they are hosting daily activities. I asked at the snack stand but they didn't seem to know. Unless you read the book in your room you will not find the lei making activity, etc. They should post these activities around the resort. 5. The main pool is too cold. We found one pool that was okay up by the Mai Tai function area. 6. If your room is on the second floor you have to carry your luggage up the stairs 7. Snorkel equipment masks are free but there are no fins. There should also be umbrellas for rent. Maybe they could recommend going to snorkel bob's around the corner and renting the package of two chairs/umbrella and cooler for $30.00 8. The gym is okay but a little small and hot 9. While there are candles in the bathroom for the balcony, there are no lights so you tend to not use the balcony at night. I would definitely recommend booking the ocean beach rooms. I think this may have added more enjoyment to the vacation. You can actually sit out on your balcony at night. We stayed in the garden unit hotel room. I think one of the main reasons to stay here would be the beach or snorkeling at Kapula Bay. We had a car but I found myself getting a little bored by the fourth day. Especially when there was a tropical storm with blowing winds and we could not sit out one day on the beach. We enjoyed our stay but I think some improvements for the price could be made. Possibly some children's games would be a nice addition. Also coffee and danish in the early morning before 7:00 from the Sea Horse for the early risers.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location but sick of the ghost ants”
Reviews.Author: bakerqueen
Reviews.Content: This is our third time here. This time, instead of a studio, we booked a 1 bedroom (2 full baths) ocean front room in the Puna II bldg. Most of the buildings have had their rooms updated. This is not one of them and it really needs it. The shower heads are the cheapest ever so we bought 2 hand held showers at K-mart and a pliers. My husband installed them in 5 minutes. We will take them home with us. You need the hand held shower to get all the sand off. The counters and cupboards are old as are the appliances. Many rooms have had all this upgraded. The other thing that we hate are the ghost ants. These are teeny-tiny ants that are everywhere. All things edible must be kept in the fridge. The ants even got in my tictac box in my purse! They also got into my husband's electric shaver head! He ended up keeping that in the fridge too. We love staying here because it is so beautiful and the beach is perfect. The bay is calm for kids too. We're just very tires of the ghost ants.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience with Napili Kai...”
Reviews.Author: dreaminparadise
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the Napili Kai, I was not overwhelmed with the beauty of the property, like I have at places like Grand Wailea or Hyatt in Kauai. I just reminded myself we did book a condo to save some money on meals to keep in kitchen and maybe use the b-que grill for dinner. (with a family of 5, meals in Maui can cost a small fortune). That didn't work out so good. The food we bought and kept in the kitchen area, had bugs in it that came from our room. We opened the cabinets and there were small (ants?) everywhere. Frustrated, we went down to the SeaHouse Restaurant on beach for dinner. My iced tea has some kind of weird slime in it, they took it away and apologized. Found a couple bugs in basket of rolls, and the food wasn't very good. Did I mention the bathroom had mildew on ceiling of shower. I just wanted to quickly shower and get out quickly, not a good feeling when you are paying $500 a night. On top of that we paid an extra $400 to guarantee a room with A/C. That's crazy! I heard some rooms are upgraded, but ours #204 in the Puna building was not!! Then we get up the next morning, go to the patio door thinking we are having a major storm, and notice a sprinkler must have broke and is spraying all over our patio door and lanai. Stinks especially when you have towels and swim wear out to dry, that is now soaked. I spoke with manager, and he let us out of last 2 nights there and we were able to get a room at the Hyatt, much better by the way. When we thought that bad experience was over, the next day, we find out our bank account is empty. Napili Kai decided to take out almost $3000. for no apparent reason. When I called to find out why, they weren't sure why, but couldn't get the manager until the end of the week. I demanded to speak to someone as to why they took out any money from our account because our room for the 2 nights was pre paid several months in advance, and only came to $470 a night not $3000. They gave us the run around, until we took a drive over there, and my husband, spoke with the manager, that supposively was gone until Friday. They did refund us the $2900, but are still curious why??? If you are staying in this area, I do recommend Kapalua Bay. It is beautiful and not very crowded. The guys snorkeled and had luck while we played on our boogie boards. If you want a nice place, we recommend the Hyatt on Kaanapali, we paid $450 a night, and our last 2 nights in Maui, we splurged at the Grand Wailea, but worth every penny, gorgeous and the kids had a blast at the pools.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Beach and Great Spa”
Reviews.Author: cazile
Reviews.Content: A serious kudos to the onsite spa. I went there twice for massages and couldn't have been more relaxed. We stayed in an oceanview studio. The shoji screens added a lovely Asian feel to the room. The kitchen is pristine. If you can't find what you need, just call the front desk. There's also a laundry room onsite which came in handy. The Napili Bay is very calm making it one of the safest beaches in Maui for children. The snorkeling is pretty good as long as you're willing to swim out a bit. We even found a pair of honu (green sea turtle) which was exciting. NOTE: Don't hover above them when you see them resting on the ocean floor. They might think that you're a predator and not come up for air and drown. Touching is also a big no-no. Leave nothing but footprints. Take nothing but pictures. Kill nothing but time.

Reviews.Title: “Broke my heart to leave!!!”
Reviews.Author: TRuDo
Reviews.Content: I booked our week at Napili Kai after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. We returned yesterday and I have to say that we were so sad to leave Napili Kai! We have been to Bermuda, other places in Hawaii, the Caribbean, etc., and I think that Napili Bay is the most beautiful beach I have ever seen in my life! I don't understand why Kapalua Bay (a 30 sec. walk from Napili) wins the 'Best Beach' awards - IMO, Napili Bay beats it hands down! The bay is a beautiful stretch of sandy shoreline with sandy bottom bay for about 50 feet out into the water - then you reach the first line of reef where you can snorkel and see all sorts of fish - go out to the '2nd line' of reef and you'll find the little pocket where a group of 4-5 sea turtles congregate (just look for the area where groups of snorkelers remain for long periods of time!) I love to read on the beach, but the view of the crystal water with the steep green crags of Molokai in the background was incredibly distracting - I kept looking up to admire the view! As to the Napili Kai Resort itself, it is not fancy. No one is taking your drink order on the beach, there is no nightlife, and our room (in the Puna Point building, #207) was a little 'dated'. However... the room was clean and comfortable and the staff was warm and friendly. The free coffee in the lobby in the a.m. was a treat, and be sure to check the ground under the mango tree when you go get your coffee for any mangoes that have dropped during the night - they are so delicious!! The resort is only 2 stories high, and feels very intimate. Everyone I spoke with there was a repeat guest (and that says a lot right there!) The grills out by the pools are great for cooking dinner, and everyone is incredibly cooperative about sharing them. We didn't think the beach was overly crowded, and the hotel beach chairs and towel service was great. To sum up - if you are looking for a luxury vacation with all the high-level amenities, then Napili Kai is probably not for you. If you are looking for a family-friendly, clean, comfortable resort on the most amazing beach, you will not be disappointed! I had looked at places on Kaanapali Beach when researching our vacation, and after 'strolling' the Kaanapali Beach walkway with our kids one day, I was thanking my lucky stars that we wouldn't have been able to afford a 'parking lot' view room there - so crowded, noisy, etc. Napili Kai was quiet, beautiful, and we had an ocean-front room that fit 5 people comfortably for $470/night.
