If I am ever lucky enough to return to Maui, we will return to Napili Kai! This was our 'once in a lifetime' family vacation, and I couldn't have been happier with Napili Kai!

Reviews.Title: “It's Okay”
Reviews.Author: PaulDurkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed in June 2008, nice property but its the wrong place and time of year if you're looking for a quiet and relaxing hotel. Great place if you have children. Beach area is nice but it's shared with a host of other hotels, you really can't see that from their web cam, so its pretty packed with little ones playing in water. Forget grabbing a nap in during the day in the summer months. Use the public access beach behind the property which can be accessed via the parking lot. Early mornings and late evenings on the beach are nice as was the ocean view from the room. Had to move rooms, first one was behind the hot tub in the main building and it got loud at night . The staff was extremely nice and helpful. Earlier reviews of their restaurant are correct, quite pricey for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing vacation”
Reviews.Author: asfreeman
Reviews.Content: I thought that this was one of the nicer hotels I have ever stayed in. I booked a studio that overlooked the ocean and was perfectly happy with all aspects of my stay. The room was nice, the view was amazing, the staff were friendly and there was an Expedia-Local Expert booking agent on the premises for finding activities. The grounds were pleasant and they loaned you beach towels, snorkles and masks so you could swim right out into the bay and watch fish swimming in the coral. The resteraunt at the hotel was delicious but a bit pricey, so I just didn't eat there more then once. If you can't find decent food in Maui, then you are not looking.

Reviews.Title: “So relaxing”
Reviews.Author: lthenell
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for small, quiet, out-of-the-way resort, Napili Kai is it. No high rise hotels, no big shopping malls, no packed beaches. The resort is sprawled over numerous acres on a beautiful quiet beach. This corner of the island tends to get more clouds, but a quick 5 minute drive south gets you to sunny beachs again. The resort is not "fancy" but it is quite comfortable, and all the amenities are above average (spa, pool, restuarant). The kid's hula show on Tuesday is a MUST see!

Reviews.Title: “Has Its Pluses and Minuses”
Reviews.Author: FlyAway522
Reviews.Content: We (myself, my husband and our one year old) stayed at Napili Kai for a week in May 2008. We are used to staying in 4-5 star resorts but decided to go with a condo this time since we had the baby with us. We stayed in the Lani II Building on the suggestion of the reservations agent. I specifically stated that I wanted an updated unit and not a dated worn out looking one. The room was on the second floor of the Lani II building which is the one further back from the ocean. It had a gorgeous view and a lanai that spanned the length of the living room and the bedroom with sliding glass doors in both rooms. The condo seemed fairly updated (though relatively cheaply) and the bathroom was clean though far from luxurious. Also, it was nice to have a second mini bathroom with a separate shower. The cottage cheese ceilings made it look a little dated but I guess that's being a little nit picky. When we initially checked in I noticed that the railing on the balcony was pretty wide and possibly unsafe for our child. Before we unpacked I called down to the front desk to ask if we could stay in the Lani I building instead which I could see had more secure balconies and I specifically asked for a first floor unit. The person I spoke with seemed so clueless and said she would call me back to let me now about availability. We waited in limbo for about an hour before we realized she was not going to call back. We just stayed super vigilant when our little one was on the balcony and never really got to relax and enjoy the view. If you have a small child, ask for a lower level unit or a unit with glass balcony instead of the metal railings. Overall the unit was basically clean. (Only found one pincer bug on the toilet and two geckos near the ceiling in the living room. No roaches.) Baby items were provided including a crib with bedding, a diaper pail, and a high chair. When we went down to the pool area, they gave our little one a sand bucket and shovel and an umbrella and the service down there was very nice and friendly. It is a family friendly area and that, along with the location, are the biggest pluses. Two quick notes: We both had massages at the "spa." The massages were good but unfortunately it was the massage therapist's last day. There really is no spa to speak of, just a room where you get a massage. No showers, no hot tub, no sauna. I had a scrub and left with grains of sugar all over me because they really are not equipped to do a real scrub like you'd get at a spa. It's ok as long as you know what you're getting (or not getting). The kicker is that they charge just as much as a nice hotel spa. Their prices should be lower to reflect the lack of amenities. Stay away from the SeaHouse Restaurant unless you are just going for cocktails (the view is great). Ordering anything more there is not a good idea. The first time we went there I ordered chicken tenders for our daughter and as I was cutting them up for her I noticed they were totally raw inside. Thank goodness I hadn't given her any yet. The rest of the food was barely edible and not tasty. We stayed away until the last day when we decided to give it another shot this time for breakfast. I ordered a bowl of fruit for my daughter. I tasted the cantalope and it was totally spoiled and disgusting. I brought it to the waitress's attention. She brought another bowl of fruit saying, "This was made yesterday so it should be better." When was the first bowl made???? In my book, stuff like fruit salad should be made daily. She acknowledged that the first bowl of fruit tasted like it had vinegar in it. Both times, the servers acted really blase about the food being below par - like this was a regular occurrence. I am not sure we would go back to Napili Kai. If we do, it will be with a lower expectation and it will be strictly for the convenience of staying in a condo and the beauty of the beach. At $400 a night I expected it to be nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Mahalo Napili Kai for amazing honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: becksb
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our honeymoon at Napili Kai and weâ€™re in a depression being back here in Ohio! We absolutely loved our stay and words canâ€™t justly express our feelingsâ€¦but Iâ€™ll try. We checked in April 28th (there until May 5th) and the front desk lady was very gracious. She gave us a bunch of information including a nice congrats note on our marriage (also got a bottle of champagne in the room!). And we got a free Expedia beach bag that was very helpful. Our room was an ocean view, second floor, king bed, studio in the Lani II building. When we got to our room, we knew we were in paradise. The view was amazing! I would definitely request ocean view Lani II if you can. It didnâ€™t have AC but we didnâ€™t need it (and my new husband likes to be cool). The winds were enough. The bath was beautifully done with granite and the sink and closet were separate from the shower and toilet which is nice. The kitchen also was upgraded with granite and new appliances. The main dÃ©cor was old Hawaiian and was perfect. Comfy bed and pillows. The lanai was awesome - large and includes lounge chairs and regular chairs. And we could hear the ocean waves. That was the best â€“ going to sleep hearing the waves. So miss that! We loved our breakfasts at the Sea House restaurant. We thought they were reasonable â€“ about $25 for the both of us. They were very filling so we basically ate breakfasts and dinners the whole trip. We never had dinner there at the restaurant â€“ on the go too much. The view from the tables up front is awesome! The Napili Kai beach is wonderful. While we were there though, there were HUGE waves coming in and they had rip tide and jelly fish warnings so we werenâ€™t able to swim or snorkel (this was the same up and down the Maui coast). By the fourth day, things had calmed down. Unfortunately they were still rough enough to take my husbandâ€™s new wedding band. If someone finds it, please let me know! haha. It was great being able to get fresh towels and the beach chairs when you want. Oh and every night when the sun was setting they blew a conch shell and the tiki torches were lit. Very cool. We only had one problem with loud kids. Our last night, there was a baby next door to us who was screaming all night. And since there is no AC and the rooms are all open, we could hear her. That was kind of a bummer. But it didnâ€™t ruin the stay thatâ€™s for sure. Other things we loved: the beach path, the landscaping, the cleaning crew, pineapple and juice everyday at 10am, the shampoo, conditioner, and bath gel (you can buy these in the cute gift shop BTW), being in a quiet area, the parking (plenty), proximity to Lahaina and other POI, and the pool (great view) and Hankipanki whirlpool. Oh and the cleaning crew helped a lot when we just needed some cokes. They told us where their pop machine was! Maui was a dream and Napili Kai added to that dream. Now we just have to plan our return trip!! Mahalo for reading :)

Reviews.Title: “nice resort; a little dishonest about the view”
Reviews.Author: new2pdx
Reviews.Content: We booked a "beach-front" view, but we mostly had a view of a big orange and yellow tent (the cabana) and the pool. We were in a 1-bdrm studio, #31, in the Hanoloa building. It appears that the even numbered rooms have a better view than the odd numbers (because of the way the building is staggered). We asked to switch rooms, but they wanted to charge us a room-change fee, so we didn't switch. For the price, I don't think the "beach-front" room was worth it. However, it was a very clean, nice facility. The room had A/C and was in very good shape. We enjoyed lounging on the beach as well as the hottub. They gave fresh beach towels whenever you wanted them and had nice beach chairs. However, there weren't really any shaded areas. It was great to be able to cook in the room and eat on the lanai. But, the lanai itself was only separated from the neighbors by simple screen (if you booked two adjacent rooms, you could have opened the screen to have one very large lanai, which could be nice), This was a little uncomfortable if you both happened to be out at the same time. It is non-smoking, even on the lanai, which was a huge plus. I would not recommend the on-site restaurant, The Sea House. We went there for afternoon drinks/snacks. The food was okay, but the drinks were very watered down and the wait staff was incredibly rude and slow. And, of course, everything was very over-priced. It's definitely a "family" resort -- there were kids running around and screaming everywhere. Definitely not the best for a romantic getaway. It is a beautiful beach and the resort grounds are really well-kept, but I was very disappointed in paying so much for "the view".

Reviews.Title: “Best on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Gertiei
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this delightful resort was more than we had ever dreamed. I had read some of the reviews on this site, and there had been complaints about bugs. Our stay was absolutely perfect, and I might add, that bugs can sometimes be a bit of a problem in the tropical areas of our world, those who complained must have never traveled in those areas before. We had no problem with bugs whatever ! ! ! This resort, is very low-keyed and truly Hawaiian in every way. EVERYTHING - accomodations, beautifully manicured resort grounds, staff at check in as well as the grounds keepers, housekeepers, were the PERFECT in every way. We were greated with a smile each and every day. The nightly lighting of the Tiki Torches combined with the undescribeable sunsets will be a "Forever" Memory.

Reviews.Title: “True Aloha... I love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Keepcleanplease
Reviews.Content: I have never loved a place as much as this! Clean and always welcome. I hated to leave. I will be back and that is for sure. The staff is top notch with true Aloha spirit. View was great, room was spotless and very quite to relax and make plans to stay forever. My Husband and I are planning another trip this year. Cannot say enough!!!

Reviews.Title: “Napili Kai 2nd class citizen in the hotel”
Reviews.Author: telecombeta
Reviews.Content: Napili Kai 2nd class citizens We were customers, not guests, of the Napili Kai from 3-1 thru 3-6. Previous reviews rave about the location and they must refer to the condo portion of the property. We arrived around 11pm and after a slow check-in headed to the room. The oceanview room on the first floor of the hotel portion was large, clean and the nicest of any I had visited in all of our three Maui trips. As mentioned before parking is a serious challenge and the spaces are almost too small to exit your car. Morning began the downturn with the oceanview being a long way from the blue and behind the striped gazebo you see on the webpage. But the worst was to come. After an expensive breakfast at the Sea House we were going to sit on the lanai and enjoy ourselves when we realized we werenâ€™t alone. Half the senior population of the property was having a putting tournament and they were close enough to hear and touch and you couldnâ€™t ignore them. If that had been the only assault/tournament it would have been OK but if youâ€™re in the hotel portion you share your view, your life and your peace with golfers all the time every day. Not acceptable for $300/day. Upper floor rooms were booked and that tells you that we werenâ€™t the only ones wishing for a private vacation vs. a group outing with strangers. Donâ€™t expect solace from the Sea House restaurant. We went during â€œhappy hourâ€� which was a joke. First it was 2 to 5?? and there was no discount on drinks but the shrimp had dropped from two for $12 to two for $10. So if your life needs a $5 shrimp that costs $1.50 elsewhere the Sea House is your place. The happy hour myth was repeated by all servers at all meals. Pros: nice beach with limited shade, the water, the grounds and the whales. Cons: As pointed out in previous reviews the â€œin crowdâ€� knows more than you do and it shows in timing, accommodations and beach space. No cabanas or umbrellas to rent. Hotel provides non-reclining beach chair and that is it. So your beach time is limited or perilous to your health.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Relaxing, Simply Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Bakesie
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from Napili Kai in Maui. This makes our 3rd stay within 4 months! This hotel keeps up with the Hawaiian tradition by having daily (except Sundays) gatherings for guest to learn various things about the culture. During our stay we learned about making lais from tea leaves and weaving baskets out of palm leaves. Our first 2 stays we stayed on the ground floor ocean view room (#17 & #19). They were great and the access to the beach was literally steps away. Our 3rd visit we stayed in room 112 which is on the 2nd floor overlooking the small golf course and that was even better! The room was more spacious and the patio was private. The beach is our favorite on the island. It spread out very far and its prestine. Great snorkeling and turtle watching (early in the morning). The Sea House restuarant (on property) is some of the best food we have had on the island. We ate there for breakfast, lunch and dinner. All of the meals were outstanding. If you are looking for comfort, quiet, beauty, tradition and an awesome beach - Napili Kai is the place. This trip we never left the property because it was so nice. The staff gives personal, attentive service that is unmatched.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs, Bug Spray and Bad Food”
Reviews.Author: m9537
Reviews.Content: The hotel is next to a beautiful beach and the grounds are really well kept. If they would deal with the bugs without poisoning the guests and replace the restaurant chefs with people that can cook then this place would be perfect. As I am sure you've noticed by reading reviews this place is inundated with bugs. We checked into our unit with a toddler and there were no bugs until the 2nd or 3rd day of our stay. On the the 3rd day the bugs started arriving and staying landing on anything they could, the bedside tables and filling any glass of water you set down. What worried me the most was the large bottle of pesticide they left for me and the absence of bugs the first two days. I think they sprayed the entire unit meaning my toddler probably ingested a bunch of bug spray. By the third day it had worn off and the bugs arrived and weren't going to leave until we vacated and they could spray the whole place again. The restaurant at this place is horrible. All the food tastes like it was marinated in the same vat of mystery sauce and then over-cooked. The view is great and is the only redeeming quality of the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING FOR SOME”
Reviews.Author: lflsjet
Reviews.Content: I have been going to this resort for the past 15 years. Being that I am only 25 years old, this is a large chunk of my life. It is amazing. There is no othe way to put it. If you want a total laid back Hawaii experience, this is the place. Don't go here if you expect the full service and amenities of a place like The Ritz. The tallest building is not much larger than 2 stories. There is only one restaurant, with no room service. The rooms are a little old school. No nightlife to speak of. A lot of older couples stay here. But believe me when I tell you there is no better place in Maui to kick back and relax. The beach is amaing. Stay in the Lani 1 or 2 building for a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as last year”
Reviews.Author: funfamilytime
Reviews.Content: The Napili Kai has an incredible setting on Napili Bay ... a beach with incredible fun for the family .... body surfing, snorkeling and sea turtles to name a few. Last year we came to stay in Lani 2 and it was a vacation of a lifetime. We came back this year with high expectations but were placed in the Puna Point Buildings. Puna Point has a fabulous, unobstructed ocean view but these units are older, have a musty smell and bug problems. Little ants were all over the counter. There was a pesticide under the counter for us to spray if we wished; however, we didn't really want the residue of the spray on our food so we put up with the ants. We could have asked to change rooms but decided to stay put because of the wonderful view. The staff were professional but not as friendly as I remembered from last year. Housekeeping was hit or miss, depending on which cleaner we got. One was exceptional, the other (in the afternoon) left garbage under the sink and did not appear a happy camper. Overall, we enjoyed our stay but were also ready to move on at the end. Napili is a good location for fun and proximity to lots of excellent sight seeing and activities. The Napili Kai, as we have experienced, has the potential to be excellent. If they renovated the older rooms and upped their level of service, we would definitely want to try it again; however, next time we come back, we will likely try somewhere new.

Reviews.Title: “Greedy Policies and Bad Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: soniagabrielson
Reviews.Content: Napili Kai has a policy of making no refunds over the holidays. I think this is reasonable except that they make no exceptions, even when they are able to rent the room back out - even if you call just 24 hours after making the reservation to cancel it. We booked two rooms at Christmas, calling just 2 days before we wanted to stay there. The next day we realized our parents couldn't make it so we cancelled one of the rooms. They told us it was non-refundable meaning we were out approximately $1,500. The bad part was at check-in time our room wasn't ready. We asked to use the other room (that we were paying for) and they said they had rented it out to someone else. The clerk at the desk said we should ask reservations about getting a refund. I kept calling them and got transferred to voice-mail with no return call until my third message. They still wouldn't give me an answer and promised to call the following week. Still no call until two weeks later when they just said "no", with no apology. I told them I thought the policy was unfair and that we probably wouldn't come back. The office manager just made an annoying "uh huuuuh" sound, and that was it. We won't go back and would recommend you go somewhere else, too. Their policy comes off as greedy, and their customer service was slow, unresponsive and unapologetic.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful mid-priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: EverBuck99
Reviews.Content: The Napili Kai is a wonderful little hotel. The location and architecture are the draw here. The beach is absolutely superb, on it's own small bay. You really fell as if you are on your own private little section of the island. The hotel is very quaint , with traditional Polynesian architecture on the outside and is quite nice, but nothing fancy, on the inside. The pool is nothing special, but that's not why we were there. Overall, a great find for a reasonable price on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “A good value, but read the fine print...”
Reviews.Author: xat114
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the first 5 days of our honeymoon here. We booked an ocean view room, but when we checked in we found out it was not air conditioned. They were able to upgrade us to another room for an additional $33 a night. Make sure you select an air conditioned room, you may not need it every day but when you need it, you REALLY need it! The new room had a full kitchen, it was huge, actually meant for a family. It was considered a garden view room but we did have a view of the ocean. The decor is dated but the room was nice and very clean. The bathroom had a fantastic shower and a garden jacuzzi tub. The hotel grounds were incredibly beautiful. I can't say enough about them, wonderfully kept. The staff was very nice. They have equipment for snorkeling you can rent for free and there is a lovely beach with a coral reef to snorkel around. One of the guests spotted a sea turtle right near the beach. The hotel restaurant was surprisingly great with a fantastic view open to the beach. The hotel is about 12 minutes down from the main area in Lahaina by car, about 40 minutes from the airport. Overall I would stay there again, but be aware it is not a high luxury fancy resort. Its a very nice place, and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Pam T
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Napali Resort Dec 3-8th. Came home early because of the horrible weather. The resort happened to be fumigating the Sea House Restaurant and one of the bldgs while we were there. Our room looked towards the bay, over the roof of the restaurant. The tarp was blowing in the wind all night and we had trouble sleeping. When the restaurant finally opened 3 days after we got there, we smelled bacon starting at 6:30 a.m. Yuk!!! So, if you go, don't stay down wind from the restaurant. The resort if very nice, rooms are clean and the workers are all pleasant. Liked the cooler/ice provided during our stay. Can't say anything about the ocean cuz we didn't even get to put our toes in it!!!!!! They should offer free internet in the lobby. We went to the Slack Key Concert held on the beautiful grounds and it was great. We happened to see Ledward Kaapana with musical guest Mike Kaawa. Great personalities. Fun evening. Went up to the Pineapple Grill 3 times for dinner/drinks. Nice place and really close to the resort. I would stay again, but in another building and on the 2nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing time at Napili Kai”
Reviews.Author: Slowdriver
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Napili Kai during one of the worst storms in recent history. However, we still had a very relaxing and enjoyable time because our Oceanview studio was very comfortable and clean, and the grounds were beautiful. We liked the free pineapple served at morning coffee (saved us the mess of cutting up an entire pineapple). The location was excellent since one could snorkle at either Napili Bay or Kapalua Bay next door. Because of the storm, Napili Bay was brown and not swimmable, and Kapalua was closed unfortunately. We encountered a maximum of 10 people at any one time except during the Mai Tai night, so this is a very quiet resort. The only unpleasant surprise was the invasion of tiny ants into an open cereal box left in the cupboard. I recommend storing all food in the full sized fridge in the room. The hot tub could also have been hotter.

Reviews.Title: “A Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodTravelAgent
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Napili Kai for a way-too-short stay from December 3rd to December 5th. We just got back yesterday and we miss it already despite the torrential downpours that dogged our visit. The property is very well maintained and the view from our 2nd floor ocean view studio was magnificent. Our room was #326 in the Lani II unit. The king bed was very comfy and felt similar to Hilton's Sweet Dreams Bed or Westin's Heavenly Bed. The full kitchen was absolutely fantastic -- especially due to the temporary closure of the Sea House restaurant for refurbishing. No matter, we only made breakfast in the room once and ate out for all the other meals. The huge bathroom with marble accents was very nice. I loved the Shoji sliding screen doors from the lanai which gave the room a very elegant pan-Pacific look and feel. The rooms have no air conditioning but utilize a combination of Hampton Bay ceiling fans, open and closeable shutters and the Shoji to keep the room comfortable. The feel of the ocean air blowing into the room in the evening was so peaceful and relaxing. The beach was beautiful and had that private feel you don't find at many beach resorts. In the nightstand you'll find a small book you can take home with you which details the history of the Napili Kai. It's very interesting and will give you an informed perspective and respect for the property as you stroll its grounds and play in the surf. My one complaint which I believe has been mentioned by other reviewers is there is no lobby or beach bar. It kind of dampens the laid-back, beach resort experience when you can't order a PiÃ±a Colada, Mai Tai or Blue Hawaiian while basking in the sun. All you get are these signs: NO LIQUOR ON BEACH or something like that. Still, guests strolled the beach in the evening sipping wine or champagne and seemed to be left alone by employees and security. I plan on returning to Maui again one day and will try to stop by Napili Kai for a couple nights. Hopefully next time we won't experience the freak mini-typhoon we did yesterday :) Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: Alohababy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Napili Kai Beach Resort for 5 wonderful days. We stayed in an ocean front hotel room. We were so close to Napili Bay, I could hear the waves on the shore during the night. First, the room was amazing. Huge bathroom, separate shower from jacuzzi tub. Bedroom was also large and also the lanai. Everything appeared very clean and it was very comfortable. Had a sunset view from the lanai setting over the ocean, absolutely perfect! The staff was pleasant and showed much aloha! We had no problems at all. Everything was great, even the Seahouse restaurant on property especially at breakfast. The beach has a resident turtle that we swam with on more than one occasion. The snorkeling was terrific, the water clear, clean and so warm. The only thing I would do differently is stay longer. Coming home, I already knew that we will be returning to Napili Kai in the future!

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute Best- An authentic Hawaian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zachw945
Reviews.Content: I am an avid world traveler and have stayed everywhere from Shacks on the beach to Ritz Carltons around the globe and can tell you that this hotel is the real deal and is a true gem. Everything from the secluded private beach to the unbelievable restuarants (Their breakfast is the best on the island) was top notch with service and friendly Island attitudes to match. Every Major other hotel in Maui you might feel like you were in South Beach, Florida, or Cancun, or hell even Huntington beach Ca, But the Napili Kai is actually a bit of authentic hawaii. I plan on returning here-

Reviews.Title: “Where to start...?”
Reviews.Author: KGfromNJ
Reviews.Content: We were booked to stay at the Napili Kai at the end of what was, up until then, an absolutely fantastic, trouble-free Honeymoon. Our first issue, albeit a relatively minor one, was the parking. The parking spots are quite narrow and require you to squeeze into a spot, which isn't very comforting when you're driving a rented car. The other thing we noticed about the parking lot, which was a far bigger issue, was that they had a large garbage bin located there, which was also not far from our room assigment. This would probaly help explain the tons of flying bugs we had to wade through to get to our room. We were picking bugs off our clothes when we got to our room. Speaking of our room, it was more like a motel room than a pricey ocean view room at a Maui "resort". The furnishings were outdated and "cheesy", for lack of a better word. What's worse, our so called "ocean view" was actually a view of some kiddie golf course, a crowded pool and some big orange and yellow striped tent. If you stood out on the lanai and angeled yourself a certain way you could catch a sliver of ocean, but this was hardly what I had in mind for an "ocean view" room. Plus, standing out on the lanai was a rather unplesant experience since it was also inundated with flying bugs. Needless to say, we were less than thrilled with the accomodations already. At this point we went to the front desk to voice our concerns and, although polite, they made no effort what-so-ever to accomodate us. To be honest we weren't all that interested in staying there any longer anyway so we didn't really make much of an argument out of it either. We promptly made other arrangements at the Sheraton, which we wound up paying for out of pocket, and checked out right then. I could not in good conscience recommend this place to anyone, unless of course you're into insects, paying resort rates for a motel room, are very open minded on the meaning of ocean view, and don't mind a complacent staff. Obviously, we were quite disgusted by the whole experience. Do yourself a favor a pay a bit more to stay somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite in Maui”
Reviews.Author: seattledogs
Reviews.Content: The beach is wonderful; not too crowded & plenty of snorkeling right off the beach. The room was immaculate & view was as beautiful as advertized. We had an ocean view studio. The kitchen equip is good - full size frig, stove, and plenty of pots/pans. We were amazed at how large the room is. A wonderful relaxing place to stay and hang out; the lanai was roomy. There are several grocery stores and restaraunts in the area (not true a few years ago!). Those looking for night-life would want to choose somewhere else (or be willing to zip down to Lahaina to find it).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, fabulous visit”
Reviews.Author: NativeSoCal
Reviews.Content: Staying at Napili Kai Sept 30 through Oct 6, 2007 - we found the resort to be beautiful, secluded and quiet. The room (booked as a hotel room in Keaka 1 building) was spacious and well appointed with a view to the ocean. Sunsets from our lanai were a nightly treat. The staff was, to a person, professional and helpful. Any issues we had were immediately addressed by the front desk staff...and our lone 'problem' - someone smoking in the non-smoking building - was dealt with within 24 hours (the people were moved to a smoking building). The housekeeping staff was prompt and pleasant - and we requested specific times each day for housekeeping - which was honored. We had the same housekeeper for the entire week. Napili Bay is beautiful and easy to swim. Kapalua Bay next door is perfect snorkeling for all levels of experience. We loved the Sea House Restaurant and ate there frequently. Lunches were especially good and they tend to use local upcountry produce...and also have the best Lava Flows on the island (in my humble opinion!) A nice alternative for dining is Pineapple Grill - less than 1/8 mile up the street. Also fabulous food with local products.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Experience at Napili Kai”
Reviews.Author: dimitree
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Napili Kai Beach Resort concluded on Saturday September 29, a four night stay. The first incident occured when my wife was harrassed on the beach and accused of not being a patron of the hotel by one of the employees working in the Makai Hale because we had not signed up for a beach towel which would have identified as patrons, allowing us to use the resorts chairs on the beach. We had our own towels and chairs were not items signed out for. By the way the verb harrass was used by the employee to describe her behavior, not a description we stamped this individual with. We then asked the employee to find out about the Honeymoon package which we were identified under(we were honeymooners) in hopes of getting the sparkling wine, food certificates....etc... included with this service (as advertised and stated in our itinerary). Upon returning the towel and snorkeling equipment the employee proceeded to tell me she spoke to my wife and the resort would be taking care of this for us. Nothing was ever done and we left the resort with a sour tatse in our mouths.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Go Back”
Reviews.Author: RelaxandEnjoyMaui
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 6 glorious days in Napili Kai Beach Resort from 9/10 - 9/15. We had spent the prior week in Waikiki and wanted to relax and just enjoy Maui. Our unit was literally 20 paces from the beach. The grounds are maintained in an extraordinary manner. The staff was extremely helpful. The bay was calm and inviting. The beach was immaculate. Each night we watched the sunset from the beach (amazing).The Sea House restaurant (although pricey) was excellent. If there is a slight negative, it is the parking. The spaces are tight and there aren't enough. We would highly recommend NKBR to all visitors. Pat & Sharon ps: If you fly into Kapalua airport, you are only 3 miles from the resort versus 50 minutes from the main airport. The town of Lahaina is only 10 minutes away. .

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Old Hawaii Charm”
Reviews.Author: VCSnowbird
Reviews.Content: No high density high rises here. Local zoning laws permit nothing higher than the palm trees. The Napili Kai property on the north end of Napili Bay is a little slice of old Hawaii charm. Our beachfront room was just a handful of steps from the sand. The on site restaurant is unlike anything you will find anywhere else on the island. It sits literally right on the edge of the beach with stunning sunset view and excellent food. It's somewhat pricey but most rooms have kitchenettes and there are barbeque grills spread around the property so you can enjoy your own home cooked, in-room meals. Staff was extremely friendly, helpful and accommodating. Everywhere you turn you will see employees that have worked at Napili Kai for 20+ years which speaks volumes for the company. And I must confess, we've been returning here for vacations for 9 of the past 12 years. Napili Bay isn't the top snorkeling beach on Maui, but we found sea turtles on the reef virtually every day of our two week stay. And even over the Labor Day holiday weekend, the beach was not at all crowded. Would we go again? We made our reservations for next year when we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Bapdgm
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom Ocean Front Condo. The view was out of this world, but if you want to be closer to the bathing beach, you may wish to choose an ocean view room. The rooms are well maintained and cleaning service is available on a daily basis (they do not clean your kitchen area). The snorkeling at the beach is great and it is a wonderful resort for families with children. My 7 year old daughter loved the beach (calm surf), the putting greens and the snorkeling. The resort has snorkeling gear, but I would recommend going to Snorkel Bob's ( they also have boogie boards for rent).The Napili Kai Market is a short drive (less than 5 minutes) and was a frequent stop for food and beverages. There is also a restaurant and snack bar located on the grounds. I have no hesitations in recommending this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect setting”
Reviews.Author: clearh20snorkel
Reviews.Content: My wife and son and I met my parents here for a late Feb early March trip. I've been to Napili Kai twice before but several years ago. I was very happy to find the property exactly as I remember it, wonderfully taken care of and a perfect beach to relax on or snorkel. The staff are all very friendly and very accomodating to all our requests. The food at the Sea House was good although the drinks were not very good with one exception - the Mai Tais are absolutely fantastic! Definitely one of my favorite parts of this hotel is the fact that every morning around 10:00 they have fresh cut up pineapple (and juice and coffee but i only had the pineapple) under a tent by the beach, they also demonstrate making crafts and typically give one or several items away with a drawing. My only complaint would be that it seems like the prices are starting to get too high, but that can be said about any place. The snorkeling was perfect except the last couple days where the winds shifted and the water was just too choppy for snorkeling. The rest of the days I went out and saw jumping dolphins, several sea turtles, and tons of fish.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect relaxing week”
Reviews.Author: Soggy_Portlander
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful week! I needed a week away from a very stressful job so our travel agent recommended Napili Kai. I'm not a Hawaii girl (prefer laid back Mexico) and generally don't repeat vacation destinations but I'm sold on this spot and will return again. Why? It was the perfect balance of relaxation and activity. I love to run, swim, etc and the beach allows for running (although not a long distance) and swimming- I swam the bay every morning. It's also close to Kapalua which offers great walking/running. The condos were perfectly appointed with all you would need to cook. The Lanai has a great view of the ocean and the restaurant was excellent. There is an 18 hole putting green which my husband and I frequented, shuffle board, and the hotel does a great job of doing a couple of mixers throughout the week. We don't have kids and tend to stay away from the water slide madness- I have to say there was a nice mix but we were glad to depart the day school got out. The staff is friendly, the rooms clean and comfortable, the beach wonderful, and a fantastic spot.

Reviews.Title: “Just like heaven”
Reviews.Author: happyvacationer7
Reviews.Content: We have been going there for 30 years. we have traveled all over the golbe. Nothing beats the napili kai for warmth and kindness from all the employes. you just unwind in the unhurried way of life. If you have kids and need time away from them, they have poeple to take them on the beach or a movie. All of our friends how we have recommened the hotel to have also come back many times. We go at the same time each year. Our children have made frieds of the families that come at the same time each year. Now there children have made new friends too. This is just like going to heaven. The bay has very little wave so swimming is easy. This year a pod of dolphine came into the bay and stay all day just swimming around all of us. Happy vacationer from Los Angeles

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it”
Reviews.Author: sfresident
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a week at the Napili Kai Beach Resort and are already dreaming of our next trip there. We stayed in an oceanfront 1-bdrm condo in the Puna Point building and found it perfect for us. It's the building the furthest from Napili Beach and the restaurant... but that means about a 30-second walk. We were also literally just a few steps from Kapalua Beach so it was nice to have both beaches so close. The grounds are beautiful, the staff very pleasant, the food at the Sea House restaurant excellent for both breakfast and lunch, and the beach and surf fun. As others have said, it was great that they don't "nickle and dime" guests. We felt it was a good value. We purchased a package through Pleasant Holidays. The relative remoteness of the area is either a plus or a minus. It definitely is remote from the east side of the Island (we didn't even bother trying to do the Road to Hana or Haleakala because it would have been too much driving), but we found it delightful because the beach was quiet -- not a madhouse like Kaanapali area. Kaanapali is only about a 10-12 minute drive south... but good luck finding parking down there. We barely left the resort the whole week because we had almost everything we needed there: restaurant, BBQ grill, 2 great beaches, 4 pools, snorkeling, bodysurfing... About the only thing I would do differently next time is to spring the $20 or so to rent snorkeling gear at Snorkel Bob's for the week (conveniently located just down the street). Though the resort gives out free snorkel masks and tubes (not fins though), it was an exercise in frustration because most of the time they either weren't giving them out because of perceived high surf or, on the days they were giving them out, there weren't enough to go around so I ended up renting from Snorkel Bob's anyway. We definitely hope to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great classic Hawaii experience!”
Reviews.Author: SuzSteve
Reviews.Content: Reserved after reading reviews and did not disappoint! Property was immaculately landscaped and all rooms face the beach/ocean. We stayed in a king room (no kitchenette), but still had coffee pot and mini-frig. The room was beautifully appointed, with classic Hawaiian rattan furniture, lanai, large bathroom with whirlpool tub, separate WC, couch, and dinette. The toiletries were wonderful. Room had a safe, ironing board, hairdryer. Only minor problems with cleanliness (the light switches and near TP holder-yuck). Only substantial concern was--the walls are thin!- which wouldn't be a factor if your room was a suite. On-site restaurant had limited hours (along with bar), and had a rather up-scale dinner menu (nothing light), and we had to be sent somewhere else to eat upon our arrival. Since everything is a drive, it would be helpful for the desk to have menus for review...it's tough to drive a few miles only to find out the menu is too heavy or pricey. The beach is beautiful, located on a cove with good snorkeling. There were sea turtles. You can borrow a mask and snorkel (and towels) but they don't have fins--Snorkel Bob's has better very cheap for rental. Negatives: Lobby coffee available only very early, before the restaurant opens, I guess for people with early tee times. Concierge seemed very disinterested and randomly tossed pamphlets from the rack at us. Recommended a restaurant and had no menu to review. No luggage service was offered. Parking is difficult--spaces are few and tiny! Many many spaces marked for employees unnecessarily. And landscaping crew started pretty early! But, for what we were looking for, this would not deter us from staying there again! If you want a Hawaiian themed resort, with basic on-property services, a to-die-for view and direct beach access--this is the place for you. Short drive to major site, less than five minute walk to a convenience store.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: calpyro
Reviews.Content: My husband, 20 month old son and I spent 6 wondeful days at Napili Kai in Late April 2007. It was absolutely fantastic! The staff was always very welcoming and friendly no matter what we needed. We really appreciated the friendly welcome call and little non-intrusive ways that they reminded us of the events happening during our stay. The Napili Kai thinks of so many little details of things to take care of you - it is really nice. We loved having the kitchen space since our son never really adapted to sleeping to Hawaii time... it let us get up cook breakfast and enjoy the morning, long before the rest of the resort awoke. We were on the beach by 7:30 every morning! Speaking of the beach - it is amazing! The snorkeling was WONDERFUL!! So many things to see, and they have the loner equipment you can use! They also had coolers and other things to loan. The housekeeping staff was wonderful and everytime they cleaned out a room where beach toys had been left behind, they offered them to my son... he loved all the water noodles that ended up by our room! We will definitely be back to the Napili Kai next year... but this time we will bring the grandparents with us (they are quite a bit older) since they would love the resort as well... we didn't use it, but they offered golf cart service around the resort to those needing assistance... we thought that was a great touch! Thank you Napili Kai for such a wonderful trip! We can't wait until we are saying that we have been coming for "X" years!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: lovehotels_10
Reviews.Content: While I agree that this resort is rather expensive, I felt it was a great value. When we go on vacations, we tend to relax and not do many (or any) excursions. We enjoyed many of the things Napili Kai had to offer. I loved that everything other than food was included -snorkel equip, putters, parking, hula lessons, manager's cocktail hour,etc. We also did the Monday night putting party for adults where they serve $0.50 cocktails - we met lots of nice people and continued to see them throughout our stay. I have stayed at many hotels lately where I felt nickle and dimed (resort fees, parking,etc) so it was very refreshing to have everything included. Most of the people staying while we were there were repeat guests and I can see why! My family of four stayed here a week beginning the Saturday after Thanksgiving. We had a 1 bedroom ocean front suite in the Puna Point building. We had amazing views of the sunset - we had a 2nd floor room that was practically sitting on top of the water. This is the furthest building from the beach/restaurant but the walk to the beach was along the bay on a lava rock path and we didn't mind it.(If you have children 3 or under, this is not a good walk for you). I also liked that the buildings in all of Napili Bay-not just Napili Kai- are all low rise (looked like 3 or 4 stories)- it just enhanced the low key feeling of the place for me. The room itself was nothing fancy - but it was clean and I loved having a second bathroom, not to mention the extra space that comes with having a bedroom and a living room. They were renovating some of the units in the Lani Building while we were there - they looked nice - new appliances and granite countertops,etc. Our kitchen was equipped with everything we needed. We swam in the pool at our building most days and only saw one other person the whole time - this is likely due to the fact that the week we were there is one of the lowest occupancy periods of the year. The pools aren't anything like a resort pool - no water slides, etc. they're basically like a pool you'd find at a condo. The beach was great and having chairs there for guests to use was nice. I never felt like I had to run to the beach in the morning to reserve a spot. I liked the proximity of the beach to the bar and the snack shack. My children's (ages 6,5) thought the best part was the putting green and we played every day. We also went to the hula show that the foundation does once a week. Was enjoyable and our kids loved it but don't go expecting a Broadway show. They invited the kids on stage to hula also which was fun for them. The staff were great. The daily talks they gave on the Hawaiian culture were very informative. It seemed that most of the staff have worked there a very long time which says alot. We had a great time at the Napili Kai and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Kleoviii
Reviews.Content: Heaven, Perfect, Would never stay any place else!!! Not cheap but worth every cent. There is so much to tell I don't know where to start. You have the feeling of being on a private beach, The resturaunt is one of the best on the island and only a few feet away from the beach so very convienant for coctails while sunning. The bay is one of the best for snorkling, I did that everyday. The resort itself is perfect, roomy and clean. The entire staff is helpful and friendly. The boutique on the property is fun and has great gifts. The surrounding area is wonderful, close to all shopping. I will only stay here in the future and would not hesitate going there alone. The most relaxing, perfect vacation I have ever been on. Buy the book "Maui Revealed", it gives you insight to local sites that you wont find anywhere on the island. My friends were glad I had it we learned so much about the island and like I said saw sites that were not advertised anywhere. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Love Maui & Napili Kai !”
Reviews.Author: Crazysexycool
Reviews.Content: Returned from Maui the last week of February. Stayed a week with my son (8) and husband. Direct flight from LAX, United, @ approx. $2800 for the three of us (air, hotel, rental). Hotel grounds very beautiful. Beach awesome. Oceanview studio, very cozy, spacious no complaints at all. We ate breakfast at the hotel once. Food absolutely delicious, but way overpriced for the portions. The plan was to shop for groceries and prepare our own meals, but we soon realized it would be cheaper to just eat out, after browsing the lanes at the grocery store. A carton of OJ was 6 bucks! The weather was nice. About 80 degrees, with sporadic showers and gusts of wind. The week we were there, the crowd was mostly 50+ (it seemed) and families. If you're looking for a slow paced, quiet type of environment, Napili Kai is it. FYI: I have more pics to show of the room, but they are very large files and I do not feel like shrinking them. If you want to see them, I'll be happy to email them to you.

Reviews.Title: “Dec/Jan 2007 stay”
Reviews.Author: maybelle22
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our stay a Napili Kai Beach Resort. We stayed from 12.2606 - 1.4.07. The weather was not bad. We had some rain. The temperature reached 84 degrees during some days. Our room was adequate and the view enjoyable. The price is expensive but Maui is expensive -- especially the time of year that we are able to go. The resort is supposed to loan snorkel equipment but refused the day my daughter wished to go into the bay. She had to go elsewhere to rent snorkel gear. It was implied that the water was murky so there could be the "s" word. Did not hear this from any other place though. The drinks ordered from the bar were not too exciting. Don't drink margaritas in Hawaii! Ordered a blended margarits and it was handed to me already separated. The bartender did not know how to run the blender to blend the drink. The main problem we had was with our booking agency, The Visitor Center. I would never use them again. Whatever could go wrong did. It was difficult communicating and many errors were made. We were talked into one booking with multiple families. Don't ever do this!!! Big mistake and no accountability will ever be taken by The Visitor Center. The other people we were traveling with happen to call the airlines to see where we would be sitting. The Visitor Center never bothered to reserve seats for us. We then thought we should do further checking and called Napili Kai Beach Resort ourselves. They had us staying with the wrong people. They had my husband staying with the other person's husband and the other wife staying with me. We were able to resolve this error after we arrived. Unfortunately, we had to cancel one person due to an injury. My mom is 84 years old and fell. But the time of year we made the reservations, The Visitor Center makes no changes AT ALL. We, fortunately, took out cancelation insurance with Travelguard. We are still waiting for reimbursement from Travelguard because they have to wait for confirmation from The Visitor Center. It has probably been three months since the cancellation process for my mother started. Again, it is all being held up by The Visitor Center. The person we originally booked with is no longer there. He was the one who pushed for us to have one booking. In retrospect, I don't know how I could have been so foolish. If you make one change (when changes are even allowed), the penalty is $100 per person. Another reason it does not make any sense at all to do a multiple booking. If you wished to upgrade a car, the cost would be $100 person. So if you made a group reservation for 7 people, wham!!! $700.00. I made several calls to The Visitor Center while in Maui. The response that I got from them was to write a letter - so here's your letter. I have sent many an email! Outside of the problems we had with the Visitor Center, you just cannot help but love Hawaii. We snorkeled in Napili Kai Bay and saw great sea life - right there! We saw turtles and many different small fish. We had some great dives with Lahaina Divers. We dived the back side of Molokini (my favorite), we also dived Cathedral II, and other sites. Lahaina Divers' did a great job - good people. For the price, $300 a day, I expected a little more. We had an ocean view studio. House keeping does not touch the kitchen, which is no big deal, but just think you should probably get a little more for the price and what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Napili Kai is a great experience”
Reviews.Author: voyager61
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful holiday stay at Napili Kai Beach Resort. It had been about 7 years since our last time there, but we were happy to find it as lovely and accommodating as always. This. little gem on Maui, located on a beautiful beach in the quietest corner of Maui's many tourist areas, offers clean and nicely equipped condos, great service, several pools and a good restaurant and bar. Conveniently, next door and within walking distance is Kapalua Bay, which is a favorite of snorkelers. Napili Kai is a perfect family vacation spot, relaxed but with quality amenities and excellent aloha.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: rochne
Reviews.Content: Wonderful quiet place to relax and be spoiled. Great location, Sea House is perfect for meals, putting greens are challenging for a few betts, overall a fun place to stay. Fantastic hot tub open late, only draw back is cool pools.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay at Napili Kai”
Reviews.Author: Sungodess88
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice. There was a funny smell when we walkied in our room. The people who worked there we very nice, and the gounds and beach we the best. We were bothered by the fact that we were paying a lot to stay there, and they didn't even do our dishes! Oh well, we were happy over all, Napili Beach is sooo beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “This was the best”
Reviews.Author: nicunurseca
Reviews.Content: I was leary because I heard the weather in Maui is better in the south part of the island but this was a clean and very RELAXING place. I am very picky when it comes to the cleanliness of the room but Napili Kai was great. Plus we had the best dinner ever right there at the resort. Great with or without kids. And please skip the trip to the crater! Go to hana instead.

Reviews.Title: “This is how Hawaii is supposed to be!”
Reviews.Author: stonemanmb
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I stayed at Napili Kai from July 23 thru August 1, 2006. Neither of us had ever been to Hawaii before, and friends had told us that we needed to go to Maui and stay at Napili Kai because it was how Hawaii was meant to be! Using my frequent flyer miles, we were able to fly first class both ways on United from LAX (nonstop). That was a perfect beginning to the trip. Once in Maui, we rented our car from Dollar (a Chrysler Sebring) and made a stop at Costco. I highly recommend going to Costco prior to getting to Napili Kai if you are looking to save some money. Check-in was a breeze, and they upgraded us to a corner room in the newer part of the property. All I can say is that this room was simply amazing. 20yards to the water, 3min walk to the sandy beach, unobstructed views...it doesn't get much better than that. Beach is perfect for Snorkeling and relaxing. They rent everything at the beach for free...so snorkels, masks, chairs, towels...you name it. We rented an ice chest for the entire time we were there, and brought our own drinks down to the beach, and took it with us in the car. If you are looking for some good Sushi while you are there, try Sansei @ The Kapalua Shops. It's about a 5minute walk up the road, and they have the best Sushi i've ever had. We ate there twice and wanted to go back more! I could go on and on about this place, but you have to see it to believe it. Just a few things to help you while you are there... 1) Go grocery shopping before you get there. The rooms have full-size fridges, microwaves, stove and oven. If you are looking to save some money, this is the way to go. We ate every breakfast and lunch in the room, and only ate out for dinner...it saved us some serious $$$$$. 2) Go down the road to the Shell station at Kahana and buy some inflatable rafts at their mini-mart. They are only a few bucks, but it's so relaxing to float around the bay on these. When it's time to go, donate them to someone else who's just getting there. 3) We rented a convertible Chrysler, and loved every second of it. Don't worry about Valet parking...they have plenty of parking right outside the rooms at no charge. 4) If you've never been to Hawaii, you should really see a Luau. We walked up the road to the Ritz Carlton, and it was one of the best dinners we have ever had. All the food and booze is included, so All you can eat, and all you can drink! The concierge at the hotel booked it for us. They are really helpful! Trust me, once you stay at Napili Kai, you will return back year after year. It's truly how Hawaii is supposed to be.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort!”
Reviews.Author: louielace
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Napili Kai Beach Resort after a fabulous one week (too short!) stay. The hotel is on Napili Bay, sheltered from the big waves. They provide snorkling equipment to enjoy the many fish among the coral. (One tip, we used cheap air mattress to float and snorkel.) The beach is perfect for swimming, calm and beautiful. The staff was wonderful, catering to any needs. There is a putting course on the property which we enjoyed daily. Everyday at 10:00 at the cabana, fresh pineapple and drinks are served along with a short Hawaiian history lesson (ie, origins of long boats, leis, etc.) The Sea House Restaurant on the property is one of the best in Maui. I would recommend this resort to anyone who wants a quiet, peaceful, beautiful resort right on the beach. The resort is 2 story, with only 180 units, all facing the beach.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in West Maui”
Reviews.Author: rshaine1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. This was the quieter more reserved resort we stayed at and we ended up loving it the most. They donâ€™t nickel and dime you like the big resorts and they have a beach that cannot be beat. They only have two smaller pools but it worked for us. If you go you must request the presidential suite room 231. It has an amazing view of the ocean, mountains and beach on two sides of the room. It is fabulous. I had read reviews that said that this place was more geared towards families: They were right. There were a lot of multi-generational families (grandparents, with children, and grandkids). But, nothing detracts from how absolutely terrific the Napili beach is for snokling, how huge the rooms are, and that all the equipment is free to rent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to begin a honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: MTJK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Napili Kai for 4 nights, August 8 - 11, 2006, it was the first place we stayed on our honeymoon. I thought I knew what to expect because I had done a lot of research about the resort, however, I was pleasantly surprised at how wonderful this resort was. Our room was large, it faced the putting green and was considered to be an "ocean view" room. The bathroom was great because it had double sinks, a shower and a tub. There was also a refrigerator that was empty except for 2 sets of drink glasses. We visited the Napili Market to buy drinks and snacks, though expensive, it was nice to come back and have a place to put our goodies. We found the staff to be considerate and kind. We didn't have any issues at all. The beach is fantastic here! We went swimming a lot and also took advantage of the complimentary snorkeling equipment. The bay has several nice places to snorkel, we saw a varitey of fish and sea turtles!!! The only thing we were slightly disappointed in was our first time eating at the Sea House restaurant which is right on the beach. We tried it for dinner our first night. The food was just OK and the service was really SLOW. We received our appetizer before our drinks. However, we went back for breakfast on a different day and we had a great experience. My hubby loved the macadamia pancakes, I enjoyed my b-fast croissant sandwich, but wished I would have ordered the crabcake eggs benedict. After staying here we stayed at the Westin on Ka'anapali Beach and I was disappointed that we had to move. Although it was twice the price to stay at the Westin than Napili Kai, it was so not worth it. Napili Kai is a fantastic resort and does a wonderful job making you feel comfortable and like you are really experiencing Hawai'i.

Reviews.Title: “I dream of Napili Kai”
Reviews.Author: hairdiva35758
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a trip of a lifetime in Febuary of this year. We stayed at the Napili Kai and felt like we had found our own little paradise! In a world of high rise condos which are crammed in on top of each other, the Napili Kai was a breath of fresh air! We stayed in the hotel part and the room was huge! The resort itself is fairly easy to find back behind a residential area on the beautiful horseshoe-shaped Napili Bay. This beach area, which was right outside our door, is one the best beaches to play and lounge on in the west beach area. The landscaping was beautiful and very well maintained --we saw (and talked to) staff every morning who were busy working around the grounds. Every morning we walked the Bay --golden sand beach anchored on each end by wonderful lava-rock boulders which were fun to explore. They have a little coffee bar with a wonderful hostess named Lorene who absolutely got me hooked on Macadamia Nut Latte's (3 squirts of syrup!). The lanai in our room looked out over a putting green with the ocean in the background. None of the buildings in this resort were over 3 stories tall and the buildings surrounding the putting green were only two stories. This is truly what I picture when I think of Hawaii! I dream of going back some day and I will stay at the Napili Kai!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location”
Reviews.Author: EGD
Reviews.Content: The Nipili Kai Beach Resort is in a very lovely location with a wonderful horseshoe beach and beautiful views. We stayed in an ocean view studio that was almost like beach front. This resort depends largely on the Trade Winds for its airconditioning as most of the accomodations are without air. To pick up airconditioning we would have had to downgrade to a hotel style room with a garden view but after traveling almost 6000 miles we chose th view over the airconditioning. Although this turned out to be acceptable there were times when it was quite sticky. The resort provided us with an extra fan which did help a little. This resort is immaculate, extremely well maintained and friendly. We were there for 4 nights from 7/23/06 to 7/27/06. To acheive the best views you need to be on the 2nd level of the complex which we were and the view was breathtaking! This resort is very much geared to famlies although this did not detract from our stay. Breakfasts at the Sea House Restaurant were very good and reasonable for Hawaii and averaged about $12.00 per person including Omelets, macadamia pancakes etc. The front desk recommended a wonderful Northern Italian restuarant called Vino's. We had dinner for 4 including wine for about $50.00 per person including tax and tip. (All entrees were excellent) The atmosphere was very classy and the service was great. We did the dinner cruise on the Spirit of Lahina (a catamaran) which well worth the cost of about $70.00 per person plus tip. The food was very good and the service great for this type of adventure. We highly recommend this activity. We also did the Luau at the Feast of Lei Lei which was very nice but a bit pricey at $105.00 per person plus tip. What made this Luau exceptional was 1. no waiting in line (reserved seating) 2. Limited to 150 people 3. a beautiful setting and a great show. The food was very authentic and not always to our taste but we really have no complaint. There are lots of Luaus available in different price ranges but we recommend that you be sure to get reserved seating (not wait in line) at private tables, as at Lei Lei, in a beautiful setting for a great show. Ultimately this was worth the price as well. We did drive the road to Hana with friends but to appreciate it you must commit at least 10 hours and you may want to stay over night in Hana which is in the middle of "no where" which is as the locals prefer it. It is a very slow winding trip with at least 54 1 lane bridges and 150 hair pin turns. Although the actual trip is 37 miles most of the time you are driving at 10 to 15 miles an hour. You can get a bit car sick so be prepared. To get the most out of the trip you will be making many stops and need to hike to many of the attractions. We were glad we did it but we wouldn't necessarliy do it again. All in all Maui is a wonderful destination and we would like to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “The very best on Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wanted to stay somewhere very special for our 20 aniversary, well we found just the place. Napili Kai had everything that we wanted. If you want an ocean front room spend the extra $ and stay in Puna 11. We had room 231 and the view was worth evey penny. The beach lacked not a thing. Snorkling right off the beach was fantastic. We did not see any turtle here, but just around the point we had no problem finding them. We put 700 miles on our rental car wanting to see all of Maui, but we could have just as well stayed right here too! Very romantic setting but also great for the family. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Elegance”
Reviews.Author: henryfla
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults and kids 8 & 11) just got back from a 5 night stay at the Napili Kai and for us it was really great. The beach and related snorkeling may be the best on the island and it was absolutely perfect for the kids. The grounds are beautifully landscaped and superbly maintained. The food in the open air restaurant is very good and the views are wonderful. The rooms are clean, well maintained and more spacious (we did have had a suite) than most hotels. It's a peaceful resort that is really nice, but definitely not stuffy. Napili Kai was such a refreshing change of pace from all of the fast pace highrise hotels and condos that permeate so much of this island - if that's what you want you may as well go to Florida. So the bottom line is if you are looking for a place with true old Hawaiian charm that has the potential to create memories for a lifetime then give this place a try. It's not cheap, but you probably will leave feeling thankful that you found this piece of paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Beautiful and Calming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There were many reviews here that had me worried but I was extrememly pleased with Napili Kai. We had an Oceanview Studio in Lani II (Room 333). We had a view of the bay with Lanai and Molokai in the distance. Our room did not have air conditioning and being from Florida I was worried. We left the patio doors open, opened the slats on the front door, closed the bug screen and slept wonderfully. The breezes coming off the mountains and the occasional shower passing through made it so cool that I needed a blanket some nights. The kitchen was fine, it had everything you'd need. I also saw rooms 327 and 331 and they were equipped and decorated just like ours. What had me most concerned were the comments about bugs everywhere. I did not see one insect what so ever. The room was spotless and cleaned thoroughly every day. I thought the food at the restaurant was very good. I had the Belgian waffel for breakfast, a seafood stir-fry for lunch, the Lani ribs for lunch, and the Filet Mignon appetizer for dinner. All were very good-great view and service too. Of all the Mai Tais I had in Maui - Napili Kai's bar was the best. Beware of a 50 cent charge to take one to-go though. The resort has a fascinating history. If you are looking for something to read on the beach or by the pool there is a little book written about the resort in the bedside table drawer. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. I visited the Westin Maui which was a whirlwind of people and activity. Napili Kai was much more laid back and relaxing. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Hawaii four time and this is by far the best place we have stayed at. We would stay here again. The only downfall is some of the rooms do not have air conditioning. Other then that everything else is great, the rooms are clean and have a relaxing lanai. Awsome beach and great service. Unbelievable snorkeling, turtles right off the beach.

Reviews.Title: “We were quite pleased.”
Reviews.Author: lovin'maui
Reviews.Content: Our beachfront studio was great. Kitchen looked newly redone and lanai was spacious. Loved our view. Loved being lulled to sleep by the sound of the waves each night. We had a unit with just a fan(all we needed) so we didn't have to deal with any musty air conditioner smells some people have mentioned. Grounds were very nice. Only problem was rates are a bit to high for what you get. Overall, we were happy we chose this property over all the other Napili properties.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, accomodations leave much to be desired”
Reviews.Author: cdnliving
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 who spent 9 days at the Napili Kai in a one bedroom beachfront room on the second floor. Let me begin by saying, this is the first time I have never found fault with a property we have stayed at in all our travels, however I felt it only fair to others incurring this expense to share our findings. This property is beautiful, well manicured & maintained with lovely vegetation and a lovely stretch of beach. Additionally the 18 hole putting green is well manicured,and was enjoyed by all. The unheated pools were always clean, and always quiet. The workout room was quiet & nicely equipped for a resort of this size. The Sea House restaurant on the property served decent fare. As for the accomodations, we were sadly disappointed. Although we didn't have plans to spend much time in our room, we were paying a fair amt. at $500 cdn/night (taxes in), and had hoped they would be nice. Our room was furnished with VERY modest furnishings (think: motel 8): standard beds, bamboo dresser, laminate/bamboo tables, painted clapboard ceilings (with holes), musty smelling carpet, and the entire unit had an intense smell of mold throughout. The staff recognized that the room smelled of mold on our arrival, and tried to to alleviate it with the use of ionizers and airfesheners but unfortuantely these were unable to remove it. According to two of the staff we met, a number of units in our bldg had ongoing problems with mold related to a problematic airconditioning system - they mentioned 4 units that were badly affected, ours being one of them. This was very evident not only because of the smell, but the visible mold on the ceiling tiles all around the airconditioning vents. On the third day, the a/c vent was leaking lots of water all over the floor, and on our clothing. Maintenance came and spent 3.5 hrs draining it and drilling to stop it from leaking. This worked to stop the leeking and the moldy smell seemed a little less strong, but still prevalent throughout the unit. We have travelled extensively throughout the Caribbean and are quite comfortable with the characteristic musty island smells that tropical climates have, however this was not remotely the same - this was a strong MOLDY smell. We requested a room change, however unfortunately all the rooms in the Lahaina and Honolua buildings were at full occupancy, so this request was unable to be met. Additionally, the neighbouring resorts were also at full capacity so we were unable to move. We made the best of it, however it was upsetting that for the amt. of money this resort charges, that our room wasn't even comfortable to be in. Thank goodness for the lanai which we actually contemplated sleeping on to get away from the smell. So, although the resort has lovely grounds, the price of the rooms in no way reflects the quality of accomodations. We met many wonderful guests at the Napili Kai. In fact, most every one we met were either shareholders, or friends/family of shareholders, and had all been there many times. I can see how this property would hold dear to all those who have shared years of family memories there -nostalgia. It truly does have that "OLD HAWAII feel to it - translation 70's feel -and that can be quite charming. It's was nice to be apart from the highrises, and shopping areas. In fact we were looking forward to that. All units however should have the same quality of accomodations, and these should be in line with the price. At $500.00 cdn/night - this hotel lacks the lustre that you would expect for a hotel in this price range. Addtitionally, because this property is well frequented by its many shareholders and their family/friends, I have to question whether the general public get the least choice rooms in the room assignments. We booked our vacation 71/2 months ahead of time, and at the time of booking were told there was a lots of availability...Bottom line, No rooms should have mold problems. Those rooms with such should be pulled from inventory until their problems are properly fixed. It would have been far nicer to be told ahead of time that there were no available rooms at the Napili Kai and find something else, than to travel half-way accross the world to be told - sorry your room smells strongly of mold - we've had a problem with that, but it's all we have. My advice is this - if you have your heart set on staying here, and you're not a shareholder, definitely pay the extra $300.00 U.S. to secure a "nice" room - if you can find where that one exists. In the end, we wouldn't consider staying here again at this price, even if the mold/air conditioning issues were resolved. The units were modest at best, and the managements minimal attempts at ensuring guest comfort were disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise-Great Escape!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed in an ocean front, second floor unit and we were very pleased with it. Since we were there during the whale season, we could see a private whale show each day right from our balcony. However, we still went on a whale watching tour so we could see the whales close up. The unit had all of the essentials you would need and it was as if we were in our own home but that we lived in Hawaii. We felt very welcome from the moment we checked in. Everyone was very kind. Even the other guests were very outgoing and often joined in on conversation easily. When you are in such a beautiful place it is easy to be kind to everybody you meet. My son met another boy his age that was staying right next to our unit and they played together often. It seems like the first thing you talk about with the other guests is where you live and how far you traveled. It's almost like a contest to see who traveled the farthest. There were many excursions to choose from and the resort's consierge was a tremendous help (thanks again Gwendolyn). We booked five different exciting things to do during our nine day visit to Maui. This is a vacation that we will never forget especially since we have hundreds of beautiful photos and three cassettes of video to remind us. I highly recommend staying at the Napili Kai Beach Resort. It's as if you are staying in a small private community with many friends and alot of smiling happy faces each and every day. We will be returning for another visit next year!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but some concerns for high price”
Reviews.Author: Justtoletyouknow
Reviews.Content: Stayed in oceanfront studio, the view was spectacular. Did notice you could hear noise from neighbours, walls are a bit thin. Also noticed management had difficulty keeping non-paying guests from using the facilities, ie. pool by oceanfront units, hot tub, chairs and parking. All in all we had a good trip and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “By far the most lovely in the Hawaiian Islands”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything about Napili Kai is superb. Beautiful beach, excellent friendly staff, great restaurant. A++++ & 10/10. We couldn't imagine staying anywhere else. Just love it.

Reviews.Title: “Napili Kai did not meet my expectations”
Reviews.Author: LFun2travel
Reviews.Content: Napili Kai is at a great beautiful, swimmable beach and attentive staff, other than that, I was not that impressed. I stayed in a garden view room (which I could actually see some ocean from), and was told these are the newest rooms. But, the room felt old and smelled strange. At 200 dollars a night, I expected more. I stayed in an economy room (60 dollars a night) at the Inn at Mama's Fish House and thought that was a fabulous place. I don't like the big hotels in the area either, but would stay in a less expensive place and just drive to the Napili bay beach. This place is okay, not the fabulous hotel I'd expected from previous reviews. If it was 100-150 dollars a night, then it would be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “No sharks here....only turtles.”
Reviews.Author: swygy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napili Kai for our honeymoon in september. The staff were very friendly and accomodating. We asked to switch rooms as they gave us one right in the lobby which they did gladly.
