Although not the most luxurious accommodation on the island the quiet setting, lovely bay and superb snorkeling more than made up for the lack of penguins in the lobby :) We didn't have air conditioning in our room but didn't suffer because of it - there was a ceiling fan which was more than adequate. The lanai's have wonderful views and it's isolation makes it a very peaceful resort. There are views of the mountains on one side and the calm bay on the other. Although our oven didn't work the kitchen was otherwise well equipped and perfect for those nights we didn't feel like eating out. The rooms were cleaned every day and overall we had a very pleasant day. If it wasn't such a long way I'm sure we'd go back again very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Love it, Love it, Love it!”
Reviews.Author: dravila
Reviews.Content: When going to Maui we stay at the Napili Kai! We received a 5 night stay at the Westin for 749.00 but extended our stay for 4 days earlier and booked here. As always, the staff greeted us with warm Aloha and went out of their way to get us checked in and comfortable! I love the room space and the kitchenette,and since I was there last, they updated the rooms. In coparrison, you can fit 3 Westin rooms in one of the Napili Kais. In the mornings it is so quiet, and you can leave your Lani door open and feed the local birds and just relax with your coffee and look out at the ocean which is only footsteps away! There are 4 pools that are beautiful, but hardley used. There is a restuarant with open air seating that is real relaxing. The beach is in a cove with snorkeling and the water is so calm you can actually get a raft and lounge out in the water all day! I don't like to put my head under water to snorkel, but the fish are so abundant you really don't need to. The hotel offers free snorkel equipment for the guests and a snack bar for the children. The guests are even nice here. I know when going into a big resort, the atmosphere totally changes. Everyone is real uptight, and people are fighting for pool chairs! There is none of that here! Vacationing with teenagers (ages 14 ans 12), I thought they'd like the hussel and bussel of the Westin, even though they do love the shopping, they said they'd much rather stay at the Napili Kai. You can give them a little more freedom at the Napili Kai. It is very affordable and worth every penny! I can't wait to go back and just unwind all over again!

Reviews.Title: “Its as Great as They Say”
Reviews.Author: slroth
Reviews.Content: I saw the reviews for Napili on trip advisor and decided to go there when I got a room over $100 lower than the Kapalua Bay PLUS had additional savings with free snorkel equipment, free parking, AND free beach chairs (all charged for at the Kapalua). I loved it. I stayed in one of the hotel rooms since it had air conditioning. the room was lovely with japanese style screens instead of curtains, a balcony, and jacuzzi bathtub. High speed wireless internet is not in the room, but can be accesses in the open air lobby. Unlike the Kapalua Bay, the hotel is RIGHT on the beach and beach is wonderful. (You can walk to the Kapulua Bay Beach in about 4 minutes if you really want to see that beach - but I thought this beach was nicer). I had great snorkeling right there - I even saw a sea turtle! The beach was a little crowded at times and loud with some kids - but still nice. I liked the free iced tea and fruit every morning on the beach. I would go there again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent suggested a stay at the Napili Bay Beach Resort on Maui for our honeymoon. We were glad she did. The service there was excellent. The staff was courteous and bent over backwards to ensure a wonderful stay for us. The accomodations were very comfortable and roomy. We had a gorgeous view of the bay from our room. The food at the hotel restaurant, The Sea House Restaurant, was fabulous. We ate there more often than any place else. I highly recommend if you're heading for Hawaii to stay at the Napili Kai. We are planning a return trip in the future. It is the ideal place to stay in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 returned from Hawaii after a 10 day stay. It was a wonderful vacation. Loved our stay at Napilia Kia, the only reason I can not give it a 5 star is the price. It is a little overpriced, but the room was great, a beautiful view. Did not need an airconditioner, was very cool at night. Left our patio doors open at night, the breeze was great. We have 3 teenage children, ages 13, 15 and 16, they all had a great time. We would have liked to have stayed longer. Hawaii is just very expensive to visit. We cooked most of our meals on the grill at night, also ate breakfast in our room each a.m. The bay was absolutely wonderful, we were there when the dolphins came and stayed for about six hours and the snorkeling was great. My children and husband are all certified divers, they actually saw more snorkeling at Honolua Bay and the Fish Bowl than they did during their 4 deep water dives. We did see a shark, snorkeling at the Fish Bowl, it was in one area for about 2 hours, and did not bother anyone, I actually gathered my courage and went out with my husband to see it!! It was about a 5 foot reef shark. We stayed in the Punta 2, would highly recommend it if the price is not too high.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: newtomaui
Reviews.Content: I could write so much about this hotel, but I'll keep it short and sweet: WE LOVED IT! Although, I do agree with an earlier review that the rooms DO vary (and not all are air-conditioned, which may or may not matter to you), but we got lucky - we ended up in an ocean front room and it was SO beautiful! Moreover, I just loved staying in the Napili area, it was so lovely and charming! :-)

Reviews.Title: “The Dolphins Made It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My review is based on bringing a 19-month old - so it's a little skewed that way. If you're bringing older kids or none at all (although beware of tons of rug rats - the place is teaming with them) your viewpoint might be different. Here's my first bit of advice about the Napili Kai - choose your room wisely. Because, while overall it is a nice place with beautiful landscaping and an attractive beach, there are differences in buildings and rooms. Which means you should a)know what you want and b)ask for it specifically. There's Ocean Front which means butting right up against the ocean (but NOT on the beach) and Ocean View which means you may see all or part of the ocean, but it's doubtful if you will hear the waves and Beach Front which means you should be able to walk just a few steps out of your room to the beach (but may or may not see it from your lanai). Confused? So was I. But these are very important points to understand, because the rooms are VERY expensive for what you get. We ended up in Puna Point, the very farthest building from the beach/restaurant/stuff. It was nice and secluded, but it was either a very rocky ocean path (nice, but they close it at night and not good if you have a small kid or trouble walking) or you had to weave your way through other buildings and the parking lot. And here's something else they don't tell you. Some of the ground floor units are NOT on the ground - they are elevated and do not open out onto the grass. This means you have the worst of both worlds when you are in a ground floor unit - no freedom to just walk out your lanai to the grounds and no great view, like the 2nd story units. So, in my opinion, avoid the bottom units unless it opens directly to the ground. Again, to me, this is a big thing when you bring a small kid. Another point about Napili Kai is there is a difference in the furnishings in some units. Ours was very utilitarian, but our friend's was furnished better with art on the walls, ceiling fans, and fresh flowers. We also, ended up looking at the pool which was brightly lit at night. And our ocean front view was obstructed by a short, stubby palm tree. Getting the idea we didn't like our room? (#207 in case you want to be sure not to ask for that one). Otherwise, it was a nice place. And one day when we where there a school of about 10 dolphins hung out in the bay for at least 6 hours. People went swimming with them and we could see them jumping and spinning from our lanai (finally, something good about #207!) Overall, here are the pros, in my opinion: * Beautiful place, sort of old school charm * Nice people * Decent food at the restaurant * Good beach * Four pools, one for each building * Snack bar that makes boozy beverages (although technically you're not supposed to drink them on the beach) * Beach towels, chairs, snorkels etc. available for free * Free Mai Tais on Wednesdays from 5:30 - 6:30 * Lots of 1 bedrooms have 2 bathrooms * Dophins (not a regular occurance, I'm told) Cons: * Very pricey for a very basic unit (no dishwashers) * Odd layout of buildings means walking through parking lot * "Stocked" kitchens means plates/utensils only. Salt and pepper are there, but you have to buy everything else * Some units are better than others and since a lot of the people here have been coming for years (25, 30 etc) they know which ones to ask for. Newbies get last picks. * See above for more specifics Generally speaking, we had a very nice time. But next time I go to Hawaii, I'll probably stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “What a place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married on the beach around the corner from Napili Kai and spent 10 days at Napili Kai for our honeymoon. This place is seriously special - the rooms overlook a beautiful sandy beach and are set in amazing surroundings. The service is excellent - someone is always on hand to help you and you can buy excursions etc in the main lobby. They helped us pick some great trips, the highlight of which was day trip to Molokai to ride mules! The atmosphere may be the greatest selling point of napili kai. One of my fondest memories (other than getting married, of course!) is of sitting on our balcony overlooking the beach and watching the ceremony they go through every night to light the lamps - pretty special! There is another restaurant close by if you want to eat elsewhere, and it is a 10 minute drive into Lahaina if you are after bars/restaurants and a fantastic sunset. Lahaina is a great place for souvenir shopping too. The rooms are perfect - great size. The food is pretty good too. We went in September and occassionally there was occassional rain but not too much to spoil the gorgeous weather the rest of the time. It would sometimes rain lightly just after sunset for a few minutes but everything was dry again in about 20 minutes! Can't reccommend this place highly enough - enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at Napili Kai”
Reviews.Author: jbutters
Reviews.Content: My new fiancÃ© and I just returned from an incredible two weeks at Napili Kai in the beginning of June where I proposed. First off mid April - early June is the best time to go to Maui because the crowds are less and the hotel offers every 5th night free. We had an oceanfront studio with a fabulous view. We saw turtles, a whale in the distance and even a school of dolphins all from our lanai. We could also see snorkelers because the rocks by the ocean front rooms offer some of the best snorkeling in that area. No need for snorkel trips you have it all right there. Ok, let's talk about the room. Our kitchen was fully stocked with a full sized fridge, all the utensils and cookware we would need. You are responsible for cleaning the dishes (no dishwasher). The only drawback was there were some small ants, so be aware of that. Nothing that really bothered us but you didn't want to leave any open food on the countertop. The rest of the room was standard but the view from the lanai and the A/C was worth the extra cost. The first evening we left the door open. It wasn't necessarily hot but its not the coolest of breezes. Another couple we met complained about the lack of A/C in there room and they were from Phoenix! So it must have been somewhat hot in there. If your looking for a friendly, calm beach with a small crowd then Napili beach is for you. It is shared with about 7 hotels so you mainly see patches of groups on the beach. On several occasions we went out at around 8 am and practically had the beach to ourselves as there were only 2-3 other people as we strolled along the sand. This beach was the best out of all of the beaches that we went to (The beach at the Ritz-Carlton is terrible - far from the hotel, windy and kinda dirty, Kaanapali Beach is nice but incredibly crowded with no shade - I'd hate to see this area at peak season, Kapalua Bay was nice but small and also a bit windy). The reviews were accurate in that most of the people staying were return visitors. Almost every couple we met had been there previous times, some coming every year for the past 15-30 years. Because of that there is a real feeling of community. If you hang around the lobby for a bit chances are you will end up in several conversations and making a new friend before you head back to your room. The first night we ate at the Sea House and the food was great although a bit pricey (we had two appetizers a piece and two drinks and the bill was $70!). Some of the things that I didn't know but I wish I did: -Internet was about $2 for 10 minutes. So if you plan on checking email prepare to pay or bring your own laptop. -Cingular works fine throughout most of Maui -It really is cold at the top of Haleakala (Bring gloves, a hat and a warm jacket) -The closest thing you come to a continental breakfast at Napili Kai are pineapple chunks - delicious but can run out quickly and they only serve it for a half hour from 10:00am - 10:30am -This may sound harsh but the $20 donation and time to watch the children's show could be better spent elsewhere. Unless you really really want to support or see the kids I'd pass. -You don't get leis when you get off the airplane Hope this helps. Overall, this place is great. Check out our pics.

Reviews.Title: “Napili Kai's wonderful ambiance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Napili Kai from May29-June 3rd 2005. We reserved a 1 bedroom ocean view studio unit. The resort gives you an opportunity to put money down for a guaranteed air conditioned unit. We did not do this, we thought we would just request that upon arrival. When we checked in we were given multiple options of units. I asked if there was an air conditioned one available. The front desk was wonderful about searching for one, and he asked if we minded the putting course view, but with air. I said that would be fine. The studio unit was perfect. The king bed, very comfortable. It was extremely clean and VERY spacious. The kitchenette was awesome, and we used it as often as possible saving our money for wonderful dinners. Speaking of dinner, the Sea House restaurant on property is scrumptous. I had the Snow Crab legs on special one evening, while my husband tried the Steak Gallagher. Our meals were absolutely wonderful and very filling. I cannot express how wonderful the beach is there. The snorkeling is SUPERB, we saw so many types of fish. It became an every day occurance to snorkel with the same family of turtles as well. A ++++

Reviews.Title: “A good resort, and we may return.”
Reviews.Author: ClearEyes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Napili Kai for 10 nights on our honeymoon, and it was our first time to visit Maui. I made a big mistake to reserve a room without a/c based on some reviews, which mentioned the terrible smells in the a/c rooms. In our first oceanview room, we had a ceiling fan, a stunning oceanview, and no smells at all. The problem was the room was worn, though very very clean. After staying for 7 night, a noisy neighbor moved in, so we went to the frontdesk to ask for an upgrade. (When we checked in, they told us if we did not like our room, they would give us an upgrade.) They offered us two rooms to pick, another oceanview and a breachfront, both with a/c, and both looked much newer, though the views were not as great as the first one. We picked the beachfront, and got it for free. Well, it did have a tiny bit smell, but not annoying at all. Anyway, all the rooms were extremely clean, as well as the whole property. A Nice location, a beautiful beach, and the snorkeling was just amazing there. Staffs were very nice and helpful, no plastic smiles at all. When we played golf there, the staffs made us feel that we were their spoiling kids. Though, we did meet a jerky frontdesk staff there. Yes, they offer a lot of free stuff: beach towers, drinks, some activities, coolers, ice, beach chairs and golf putters. Also, the resort was very quiet, and in the early mornings, the only sounds we could hear were the waves and birds. We never closed the lanai doors, and we just followed the sweet experience from the others: falling asleep with the wave sounds, and being waken up by the sunshine and birds. No worries that you cannot find a chair around the pools or on the beaches. No worries to share the pools or the golf puttings with the others. Oh, the sea house did not satisfy us though. We did not like their food, and we got a bad lunch service, while the dinner service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Napali Kai Beach Resort”
Reviews.Author: kelbry
Reviews.Content: Our family spent 2 weeks in Hawaii. We went to four islands. Maui was our favorite and it was because of the Napali Kai Beach Resort. We stayed only 3 days and wished it could have been longer! We had read reviews from terrible to excellent and had no idea what to expect. From check in to departure everything was excellent. We stayed in a 2 bedroom with a full kitchen and ocean front. It was pricey but pure relaxation and beautiful views. The unit was very clean (No bugs as per a previous review) and tastefully decorated. The staff were all exceptional. The beach was perfect for our 17yo to get a tan and for our 5yo to play for hours in the sand and the water. We sat for hours on the beach where the chairs, towels, snorkel gear and activities were provided at no extra fee. (Unlike on Oahu where we paid 40$ for an umbrella and chair). We watched the whales migrate and saw an occasional sea turtle. Our 5yo enjoyed a kids night at the movies which was well supervised and he loved it. My husband and son also enjoyed the putting green and I indulged in 2 spa treatments. We also had a great time at the weekly Mai Tai party where we met other guest staying there. We stopped for groceries, wine, beer prior to getting there and never had to leave after that. The resturant there was also excellent. The grounds were well kept and the giant whirlpool and several pools were all very clean. We would definitely stay there again!!

HotelInfo.Address: 5900 Lower Honoapiilani Rd, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761
